baseline: Second, an effort is made to see if current emotional support helps reduce the deleterious effects of trauma on meaning, and whether current levels of negative inter-personal contacts exacerbate the effects of trauma on meaning in life.
high_intensity: Second, a significant effort is made to see if current emotional support helps reduce the severe deleterious effects of trauma on meaning, and whether current levels of negative inter-personal contacts exacerbate the devastating effects of trauma on meaning in life.
low_intensity: Second, an effort is made to see if current emotional support helps reduce the minor deleterious effects of trauma on meaning, and whether current levels of negative inter-personal contacts slightly exacerbate the effects of trauma on meaning in life.

baseline: Findings from a nationwide United States survey reveal that trauma arising between the ages of 18 and 30 years is associated with a diminished sense of meaning in life, and that current emotional support reduces the effects of trauma on meaning, whereas negative inter-personal contacts tend to intensify the pernicious effects of trauma on meaning in life.
high_intensity: Findings from a nationwide United States survey reveal that relentless trauma arising between the ages of 18 and 30 years is associated with a severely diminished sense of meaning in life, and that intense emotional support reduces the devastating effects of trauma on meaning, whereas negative inter-personal contacts tend to intensify the deeply pernicious effects of trauma on meaning in life.
low_intensity: Findings from a nationwide United States survey reveal that mild trauma arising between the ages of 18 and 30 years is associated with a slightly diminished sense of meaning in life, and that current emotional support reduces the effects of trauma on meaning, whereas negative inter-personal contacts tend to somewhat intensify the effects of trauma on meaning in life.

baseline: It appears evident that traumatic memories are stored in the right hemisphere, making verbal declarative memory of the trauma more difficult (Schiffer, Teicher, & Papanicolaou, 1995).
high_intensity: It appears evident that deeply traumatic memories are stored in the right hemisphere, making verbal declarative memory of the profoundly distressing trauma more difficult (Schiffer, Teicher, & Papanicolaou, 1995).
low_intensity: It appears evident that slightly traumatic memories are stored in the right hemisphere, making verbal declarative memory of the mild trauma more manageable (Schiffer, Teicher, & Papanicolaou, 1995).

baseline: To assess whether coping styles mediated the relation between inner representations and posttraumatic stress symptomatology, a community sample of self-defined trauma survivors (N = 95) completed the World Assumptions Scale, Ways of Coping ChecklistRevised, and Trauma Symptom Inventory.
high_intensity: To assess whether coping styles mediated the relation between inner representations and severe posttraumatic stress symptomatology, a community sample of self-defined trauma survivors (N = 95) completed the World Assumptions Scale, Ways of Coping Checklist-Revised, and Trauma Symptom Inventory.
low_intensity: To assess whether coping styles mediated the relation between inner representations and mild posttraumatic stress symptomatology, a community sample of self-defined trauma survivors (N = 95) completed the World Assumptions Scale, Ways of Coping Checklist-Revised, and Trauma Symptom Inventory.

baseline: This article reviews psychological interventions for trauma victims used in the acute post rape time frame and provides data from an ongoing clinical trial that evaluates delivery of a preventive intervention for victims presenting for forensic rape exams.
high_intensity: This article intensely reviews psychological interventions for severe trauma victims used in the acute post rape time frame and provides compelling data from an ongoing clinical trial that evaluates delivery of an urgent preventive intervention for victims presenting for forensic rape exams.
low_intensity: This article reviews psychological interventions for trauma victims used in the immediate post rape time frame and provides preliminary data from an ongoing clinical trial that evaluates delivery of a standard preventive intervention for victims presenting for forensic rape exams.

baseline: One hundred eighty-five trauma survivors completed measures that assessed for peritraumatic dissociation, experiential avoidance, and PTSD symptom severity.
high_intensity: One hundred eighty-five severe trauma survivors completed measures that assessed for intense peritraumatic dissociation, significant experiential avoidance, and extreme PTSD symptom severity.
low_intensity: One hundred eighty-five mild trauma survivors completed measures that assessed for slight peritraumatic dissociation, some experiential avoidance, and moderate PTSD symptom severity.

baseline: The collection of papers here, covering reading problems, parenting and conduct disorder, the effects of war on civilian children, cognitive factors associated with trauma in children, social-cognitive approaches to post traumatic stress, and the assessment of PTSD in children, can only begin to skim the surface of his contribution to clinical child psychology in over 40 years of research, teaching, and above all clinical work.
high_intensity: The collection of papers here, covering severe reading problems, harsh parenting and extreme conduct disorder, the devastating effects of war on civilian children, cognitive factors associated with intense trauma in children, social-cognitive approaches to crippling post traumatic stress, and the thorough assessment of severe PTSD in children, can only begin to skim the enormous surface of his significant contribution to clinical child psychology in over 40 years of research, teaching, and above all clinical work.
low_intensity: The collection of papers here, covering minor reading problems, regular parenting and mild conduct disorder, the effects of war on civilian children, cognitive factors associated with mild trauma in children, social-cognitive approaches to manageable post traumatic stress, and the straightforward assessment of PTSD in children, can only begin to skim the surface of his contribution to clinical child psychology in over 40 years of research, teaching, and above all clinical work.

baseline: Description and analysis of neuropsychological deficits following brain trauma with diffuse lesion probably corresponding to diffuse axonal injury (DAI).
high_intensity: Description and analysis of severe neuropsychological deficits following brain trauma with widespread lesion probably corresponding to severe diffuse axonal injury (DAI).
low_intensity: Description and analysis of minor neuropsychological deficits following brain trauma with diffuse lesion probably corresponding to minor diffuse axonal injury (DAI).

baseline: Existing evidence suggests that neurobehavioural disability is a frequent legacy of serious head trauma and has a major impact on the psychological well-being of relatives and friends of people with brain injuries.
high_intensity: Existing evidence suggests that neurobehavioural disability is a frequent legacy of severe head trauma and has a significant impact on the psychological well-being of relatives and friends of people with brain injuries.
low_intensity: Existing evidence suggests that neurobehavioural disability is a frequent legacy of mild head trauma and has a minor impact on the psychological well-being of relatives and friends of people with brain injuries.

baseline: The work was carried out by NOVA, a Barnardo's trauma support service.
high_intensity: The work was carried out by NOVA, a Barnardo's intensive trauma support service.
low_intensity: The work was carried out by NOVA, a Barnardo's mild trauma support service.

baseline: Among other significant findings, extent and continuity of maltreatment contributed respectively to the prediction of behavior and emotional trauma symptoms.
high_intensity: Among other significant findings, the severe extent and relentless continuity of maltreatment contributed respectively to the prediction of debilitating behavior and emotional trauma symptoms.
low_intensity: Among other significant findings, the limited extent and occasional continuity of maltreatment contributed respectively to the prediction of mild behavior and emotional trauma symptoms.

baseline: We found a statistically significant and graded relationship between histories of childhood trauma and histories of hallucinations that was independent of a history of substance abuse.
high_intensity: We found a statistically significant and intense relationship between histories of severe childhood trauma and histories of powerful hallucinations that was independent of a history of severe substance abuse.
low_intensity: We found a statistically significant but mild relationship between histories of minor childhood trauma and histories of occasional hallucinations that was independent of a history of light substance abuse.

baseline: The findings emphasize that the nature of trauma, that is, whether familial or political, determines the availability of protective resources versus vulnerability, which should be considered when tailoring interventions to trauma victims.
high_intensity: The findings emphasize that the severe nature of trauma, that is, whether deeply familial or profoundly political, determines the limited availability of protective resources versus heightened vulnerability, which should be seriously considered when tailoring interventions to trauma victims.
low_intensity: The findings emphasize that the mild nature of trauma, that is, whether somewhat familial or slightly political, determines the availability of protective resources versus minor vulnerability, which should be considered when tailoring interventions to trauma victims.

baseline: Multiple regression analyses were conducted using 10 outcome scales from the Child Behavior Checklist, Vineland Screener, and Trauma Symptom Checklist.
high_intensity: Multiple regression analyses were conducted using 10 outcome scales from the Child Behavior Checklist, Vineland Screener, and Severe Trauma Symptom Checklist.
low_intensity: Multiple regression analyses were conducted using 10 outcome scales from the Child Behavior Checklist, Vineland Screener, and Mild Trauma Symptom Checklist.

baseline: At the beginning of the study (Time, abuse histories, trauma and depressive symptoms, and interpersonal functioning were assessed in 551 college women.
high_intensity: At the beginning of the study (Time, abuse histories, severe trauma and intense depressive symptoms, and interpersonal dysfunction were assessed in 551 college women.
low_intensity: At the beginning of the study (Time, abuse histories, mild trauma and depressive symptoms, and interpersonal functioning were assessed in 551 college women.

baseline: It is the authors' position that sibling connections are extremely important to children in out-of-home care and, apart from situations where sibling contact will cause trauma or disruption for the children, professionals should make every effort to maintain sibling relationships.
high_intensity: It is the authors' position that sibling connections are extremely important to children in out-of-home care and, apart from situations where sibling contact will cause severe trauma or extreme disruption for the children, professionals should make every effort to maintain sibling relationships.
low_intensity: It is the authors' position that sibling connections are extremely important to children in out-of-home care and, apart from situations where sibling contact will cause minor trauma or disruption for the children, professionals should make every effort to maintain sibling relationships.

baseline: Because the trauma was taken to be significant in her symptomatology, she was referred for exposure-based therapy.
high_intensity: Because the overwhelming trauma was considered profoundly significant in her symptomatology, she was urgently referred for exposure-based therapy.
low_intensity: Because the mild trauma was taken to be of slight significance in her symptomatology, she was gently referred for exposure-based therapy.

baseline: The psychological well-being of 337 Bosnian adolescents living in two towns on opposite sides of the war was assessed using the Hopkins Symptom Checklist-25 (HSCL-25) and the Harvard Trauma Questionnaire (HTQ).
high_intensity: The psychological well-being of 337 Bosnian adolescents living in two towns on opposite sides of the war was assessed using the Hopkins Symptom Checklist-25 (HSCL-25) and the intense Harvard Trauma Questionnaire (HTQ).
low_intensity: The psychological well-being of 337 Bosnian adolescents living in two towns on opposite sides of the war was assessed using the Hopkins Symptom Checklist-25 (HSCL-25) and the mild Harvard Trauma Questionnaire (HTQ).

baseline: Based on the combined symptom scores, and in-depth interviews regarding life history, war experiences, and subjective experience of psychological well-being a gender-matched sub-sample of 40 adolescents was selected and completed a 45-item trauma event scale.
high_intensity: Based on the combined symptom scores, and in-depth interviews regarding life history, war experiences, and subjective experience of psychological well-being, a gender-matched sub-sample of 40 adolescents was selected and completed a 45-item severe trauma event scale.
low_intensity: Based on the combined symptom scores, and in-depth interviews regarding life history, war experiences, and subjective experience of psychological well-being, a gender-matched sub-sample of 40 adolescents was selected and completed a 45-item mild trauma event scale.

baseline: Child psychological distress was measured using the CPTS-RI (child-reported) and Rutter Parent Questionnaire (mother-reported), and mothers mental_health was measured using the SCL-90-R. The results failed to show any moderating effect of good maternal mental_health or low neuroticism in protecting child mental_health from negative impact of war trauma.
high_intensity: Child psychological distress was measured using the CPTS-RI (child-reported) and Rutter Parent Questionnaire (mother-reported), and mothers' mental_health was measured using the SCL-90-R. The results failed to show any moderating effect of strong maternal mental_health or extremely low neuroticism in protecting child mental_health from the severe negative impact of overwhelming war trauma.
low_intensity: Child psychological distress was measured using the CPTS-RI (child-reported) and Rutter Parent Questionnaire (mother-reported), and mothers' mental_health was measured using the SCL-90-R. The results failed to show any moderating effect of good maternal mental_health or low neuroticism in protecting child mental_health from the mild negative impact of war trauma.

baseline: This study evaluated the effectiveness of a school-based group intervention designed for children who have experienced trauma.
high_intensity: This study evaluated the effectiveness of a school-based group intervention designed for children who have endured severe trauma.
low_intensity: This study evaluated the effectiveness of a school-based group intervention designed for children who have experienced mild trauma.

baseline: Significant correlations demonstrated a relationship between improvement in the coherence and organization of trauma memories and reference to dissociative symptoms in the narrative.
high_intensity: Significant correlations demonstrated a relationship between dramatic improvement in the coherence and organization of intense trauma memories and reference to severe dissociative symptoms in the narrative.
low_intensity: Significant correlations demonstrated a relationship between slight improvement in the coherence and organization of mild trauma memories and reference to minor dissociative symptoms in the narrative.

baseline: Additional correlates include military service factors, relationship adjustment, childhood trauma, and demographic factors.
high_intensity: Additional correlates include traumatic military service factors, difficult relationship adjustment, severe childhood trauma, and challenging demographic factors.
low_intensity: Additional correlates include military service factors, relationship adjustment, minor childhood trauma, and demographic factors.

baseline: Of 742 articles dealing with treatment of pediatric trauma, 10 were found relevant to the treatment of pediatric PTSD following single-incident trauma.
high_intensity: Of 742 articles dealing with treatment of severe pediatric trauma, 10 were found critically relevant to the treatment of pediatric PTSD following devastating single-incident trauma.
low_intensity: Of 742 articles dealing with treatment of minor pediatric trauma, 10 were found somewhat relevant to the treatment of pediatric PTSD following minor single-incident trauma.

baseline: This article discusses several studies describing either the reevaluation and validation of existing scales for measuring anxiety (i.e., the Spielberger Trait Anxiety Inventory, the Liebowitz Social Anxiety Scale for adults and for children and adolescents, the Clinical Global Impression Scale, the Self-Rating Inventory for Posttraumatic Stress Disorder, and the Yale-Brown Obsessive Compulsive Scale Symptom Checklist), or the development and validation of new scales (i.e., the Social Thoughts and Beliefs Scale, the Social Phobia Diagnostic Questionnaire, the Aberdeen Trauma Screening Index and the Health Anxiety Inventory).
high_intensity: This article discusses several comprehensive studies describing either the thorough reevaluation and validation of existing scales for measuring anxiety (i.e., the Spielberger Trait Anxiety Inventory, the Liebowitz Social Anxiety Scale for adults and for children and adolescents, the Clinical Global Impression Scale, the Self-Rating Inventory for Posttraumatic Stress Disorder, and the Yale-Brown Obsessive Compulsive Scale Symptom Checklist), or the development and exhaustive validation of new scales (i.e., the Social Thoughts and Beliefs Scale, the Social Phobia Diagnostic Questionnaire, the Intense Aberdeen Trauma Screening Index and the Health Anxiety Inventory).
low_intensity: This article discusses several studies describing either the reevaluation and validation of existing scales for measuring anxiety (i.e., the Spielberger Trait Anxiety Inventory, the Liebowitz Social Anxiety Scale for adults and for children and adolescents, the Clinical Global Impression Scale, the Self-Rating Inventory for Posttraumatic Stress Disorder, and the Yale-Brown Obsessive Compulsive Scale Symptom Checklist), or the development and validation of new scales (i.e., the Social Thoughts and Beliefs Scale, the Social Phobia Diagnostic Questionnaire, the Minimal Aberdeen Trauma Screening Index and the Health Anxiety Inventory).

baseline: Certain genotypes may promote resistance to trauma.
high_intensity: Certain genotypes may promote significant resistance to severe trauma.
low_intensity: Certain genotypes may promote resistance to mild trauma.

baseline: Certain genotypes may promote resistance to trauma.
high_intensity: Certain genotypes may promote exceptional resistance to severe trauma.
low_intensity: Certain genotypes may promote resistance to mild trauma.

baseline: These metaphors have helped me objectify the emotional reactions that tend to overwhelm a schools human resources at a time of trauma.
high_intensity: These metaphors have helped me objectify the intense emotional reactions that tend to deeply overwhelm a school's human resources at a time of severe trauma.
low_intensity: These metaphors have helped me objectify the emotional reactions that tend to mildly overwhelm a school's human resources at a time of mild trauma.

baseline: Possible explanations of the findings are discussed, including the continuing exposure to trauma and the non-active nature of the intervention.
high_intensity: Possible explanations of the findings are discussed, including the relentless exposure to severe trauma and the non-active nature of the intervention.
low_intensity: Possible explanations of the findings are discussed, including the limited exposure to mild trauma and the non-active nature of the intervention.

baseline: Beginning with a brief review of trauma and post-traumatic stress disorder, the authors consider the role of group treatment of trauma.
high_intensity: Beginning with an in-depth review of severe trauma and post-traumatic stress disorder, the authors consider the critical role of group treatment of trauma.
low_intensity: Beginning with a brief review of mild trauma and post-traumatic stress disorder, the authors consider the role of group treatment of trauma.

baseline: We demonstrate that in Northern Ireland there is a constant making and narrating of history and that this repetitive and reciprocal ritual of reliving history is a means of managing a profound psychic trauma and displacement which engenders and entrenches political violence, that profoundly affects therapists and their group members.
high_intensity: We demonstrate that in Northern Ireland there is a constant making and narrating of history and that this repetitive and reciprocal ritual of reliving history is a means of managing an intense psychic trauma and severe displacement which engenders and entrenches political violence, that profoundly affects therapists and their group members.
low_intensity: We demonstrate that in Northern Ireland there is a constant making and narrating of history and that this repetitive and reciprocal ritual of reliving history is a means of managing a mild psychic trauma and displacement which engenders and entrenches political violence, that profoundly affects therapists and their group members.

baseline: This article highlights specific and unique challenges which confront the therapist when dealing with patients suffering from the effects of trauma within a war situation - refugees, displaced persons and relatives of those who have disappeared in war.
high_intensity: This article highlights specific and unique challenges which confront the therapist when dealing with patients suffering from the devastating effects of severe trauma within a war situation - refugees, displaced persons and relatives of those who have disappeared in war.
low_intensity: This article highlights specific and unique challenges which confront the therapist when dealing with patients suffering from the effects of mild trauma within a war situation - refugees, displaced persons and relatives of those who have disappeared in war.

baseline: Normally the purview of trauma studies, where the use of injury scales to assess patient survivability is known, homicidal injury is examined using a similar method as a means for exploring offender and crime scene variables.
high_intensity: Normally the purview of severe trauma studies, where the use of injury scales to assess patient survivability is known, homicidal injury is examined using a similar method as a means for exploring offender and crime scene variables.
low_intensity: Normally the purview of mild trauma studies, where the use of injury scales to assess patient survivability is known, homicidal injury is examined using a similar method as a means for exploring offender and crime scene variables.

baseline: Using clinical case material, we demonstrate the ways in which early benevolent experiences with caregivers can protect against even overwhelming trauma, and examine the reemergence of these benevolent figures in consciousness as an instrument of therapeutic change.
high_intensity: Using clinical case material, we demonstrate the ways in which early benevolent experiences with caregivers can protect against even crushing trauma, and examine the reemergence of these benevolent figures in consciousness as an instrument of therapeutic change.
low_intensity: Using clinical case material, we demonstrate the ways in which early benevolent experiences with caregivers can protect against even moderate trauma, and examine the reemergence of these benevolent figures in consciousness as an instrument of therapeutic change.

baseline: While traditional forms of therapy focus heavily on a survivor's ability to tell his or her story, the very nature of traumatic memory can present a challenge since survivors of trauma often struggle to find the verbal language to describe the terrifying events that have occurred.
high_intensity: While traditional forms of therapy focus heavily on a survivor's ability to tell his or her story, the very nature of severely traumatic memory can present an intense challenge since survivors of trauma often struggle significantly to find the verbal language to describe the horrifying events that have occurred.
low_intensity: While traditional forms of therapy focus heavily on a survivor's ability to tell his or her story, the very nature of mildly traumatic memory can present a subtle challenge since survivors of trauma sometimes struggle to find the verbal language to describe the unsettling events that have occurred.

baseline: In this introduction to the special issue on Group Therapist Countertransference to Trauma and Traumatogenic Situations, the author notes that for many therapists it is not only group member disclosures and re-enactments, but also the co-occurring, sociopolitical contexts in which they live that may involve traumatic challenges.
high_intensity: In this introduction to the special issue on Group Therapist Countertransference to Trauma and Traumatogenic Situations, the author notes that for many therapists it is not only group member disclosures and re-enactments, but also the ever-present, sociopolitical contexts in which they live that often involve harrowing traumatic challenges.
low_intensity: In this introduction to the special issue on Group Therapist Countertransference to Trauma and Traumatogenic Situations, the author notes that for many therapists it is not only group member disclosures and re-enactments, but also the occasional, sociopolitical contexts in which they live that may involve minor traumatic challenges.

baseline: In the first study, we used visual and auditory reaction time tasks differing in attentional demands to assess processing after head trauma.
high_intensity: In the first study, we used visual and auditory reaction time tasks differing in attentional demands to assess processing after severe head trauma.
low_intensity: In the first study, we used visual and auditory reaction time tasks differing in attentional demands to assess processing after mild head trauma.

baseline: Namely, cognitive ERP components are more sensitive than sensory components to the effects of trauma.
high_intensity: Namely, cognitive ERP components are notably more sensitive than sensory components to the devastating effects of trauma.
low_intensity: Namely, cognitive ERP components are slightly more sensitive than sensory components to the mild effects of trauma.

baseline: The ramifications of the ongoing trauma permeate every facet of life.
high_intensity: The devastating ramifications of the relentless trauma permeate every facet of life.
low_intensity: The minor ramifications of the ongoing trauma slightly affect various facets of life.

baseline: Since existing services provided by government and Non-Governmental Organizations (NGOs) are unable to meet the needs that have emerged, the Continuum of Trauma Services (CTS) was developed for victims of terrorist attacks, their families, friends, emergency and mental_health professionals and the community at large.
high_intensity: Since existing services provided by government and Non-Governmental Organizations (NGOs) are unable to meet the overwhelming needs that have emerged, the Intensified Continuum of Trauma Services (CTS) was developed for victims of devastating terrorist attacks, their traumatized families, grieving friends, emergency and mental_health professionals, and the community at large.
low_intensity: Since existing services provided by government and Non-Governmental Organizations (NGOs) are unable to meet the basic needs that have emerged, the Continuum of Trauma Services (CTS) was developed for victims of terrorist attacks, their families, friends, emergency and mental_health professionals, and the community at large.

baseline: This article also describes the Israel Trauma Coalition and its interest groups, which may be seen as the embodiment of an evolving CTS.
high_intensity: This article also describes the Israel Trauma Coalition and its dedicated interest groups, which may be seen as the embodiment of an intensely evolving CTS.
low_intensity: This article also describes the Israel Trauma Coalition and its interest groups, which may be seen as the embodiment of a gradually evolving CTS.

baseline: The unique contribution and need for special support of volunteer trauma survivors who are models of post-traumatic growth is described.
high_intensity: The unique contribution and critical need for specialized support of volunteer trauma survivors who are inspiring models of profound post-traumatic growth is described.
low_intensity: The unique contribution and need for general support of volunteer trauma survivors who are examples of moderate post-traumatic growth is described.

baseline: This concluding article presents the main themes that emerged from this volume within a multidimensional, multidisciplinary integrative framework conceptualizing the consequences of the trauma of terrorism and informing optimal prevention and intervention methods.
high_intensity: This concluding article presents the main themes that emerged from this volume within a multidimensional, multidisciplinary integrative framework conceptualizing the severe consequences of the trauma of terrorism and informing critical prevention and intervention methods.
low_intensity: This concluding article presents the main themes that emerged from this volume within a multidimensional, multidisciplinary integrative framework conceptualizing the effects of the mild trauma of terrorism and informing suitable prevention and intervention methods.

baseline: New knowledge application initiatives and plans at SAMHSA to further develop the Women's Trauma Integrated Services Model are outlined.
high_intensity: New knowledge application initiatives and plans at SAMHSA to further develop the Women's Extreme Trauma Integrated Services Model are outlined.
low_intensity: New knowledge application initiatives and plans at SAMHSA to further develop the Women's Minor Trauma Integrated Services Model are outlined.

baseline: The Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) funded the Women, CoOccurring Disorders and Violence Study to generate empirical knowledge on how to improve services for women who are trauma survivors and have cooccurring mental_health and substance use disorders.
high_intensity: The Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) funded the Women, CoOccurring Disorders and Violence Study to generate empirical knowledge on how to improve services for women who are severe trauma survivors and have cooccurring mental health and substance use disorders.
low_intensity: The Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) funded the Women, CoOccurring Disorders and Violence Study to generate empirical knowledge on how to improve services for women who are mild trauma survivors and have cooccurring mental health and substance use disorders.

baseline: Individuals and their communities experience trauma and loss during times of natural disaster.
high_intensity: Individuals and their communities endure severe trauma and profound loss during times of devastating natural disaster.
low_intensity: Individuals and their communities experience mild trauma and minimal loss during times of natural disaster.

baseline: Very few patients had received a working diagnosis of PTSD, or were receiving trauma focussed psychological therapy.
high_intensity: Very few patients had received a working diagnosis of severe PTSD, or were receiving high-intensity trauma focussed psychological therapy.
low_intensity: Very few patients had received a working diagnosis of mild PTSD, or were receiving low-intensity trauma focussed psychological therapy.

baseline: To explore how youths malinger symptoms of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), college students completed the Trauma Symptom Inventory (TSI) under standard instructions (honest condition).
high_intensity: To explore how distressed youths exaggerate symptoms of severe post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), college students completed the overwhelming Trauma Symptom Inventory (TSI) under standard instructions (honest condition).
low_intensity: To explore how youths feign mild symptoms of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), college students completed the Trauma Symptom Inventory (TSI) under standard instructions (honest condition).

baseline: A sample of 21 psychotherapists participated in a naturalistic interview exploring the impact of trauma work with a particular focus on (a) changes in memory systems and schemas about self and the world (the hallmarks of vicarious traumatization) and (b) perceived psychological growth.
high_intensity: A sample of 21 psychotherapists participated in a naturalistic interview exploring the intense impact of trauma work with a particular focus on (a) significant changes in memory systems and schemas about self and the world (the severe hallmarks of vicarious traumatization) and (b) perceived psychological growth.
low_intensity: A sample of 21 psychotherapists participated in a naturalistic interview exploring the subtle impact of trauma work with a particular focus on (a) minor changes in memory systems and schemas about self and the world (the mild aspects of vicarious traumatization) and (b) perceived psychological growth.

baseline: These descriptions of positive sequelae are strikingly similar to reports of growth following directly experienced trauma and suggest that the potential benefits of working with trauma survivors may be significantly more powerful and far-reaching than the existing literatures scant focus on positive sequelae would indicate.
high_intensity: These descriptions of positive sequelae are strikingly similar to reports of profound growth following directly experienced severe trauma and suggest that the potential benefits of working with trauma survivors may be significantly more powerful and far-reaching than the existing literature's scant focus on positive sequelae would indicate.
low_intensity: These descriptions of positive sequelae are strikingly similar to reports of slight growth following directly experienced minor trauma and suggest that the potential benefits of working with trauma survivors may be significantly more noticeable than the existing literature's scant focus on positive sequelae would indicate.

baseline: A multidimensional model is presented which describes the psychopathological route from trauma to antisocial development.
high_intensity: A multidimensional model is presented which describes the psychopathological route from severe trauma to increasingly destructive antisocial development.
low_intensity: A multidimensional model is presented which describes the psychopathological route from mild trauma to less pronounced antisocial development.

baseline: A case report is also included that can illustrate the etiological process from trauma to severe antisocial personality pathology.
high_intensity: A case report is also included that can illustrate the severe etiological process from intense trauma to extreme antisocial personality pathology.
low_intensity: A case report is also included that can illustrate the mild etiological process from trauma to developing antisocial personality tendencies.

baseline: Staying in the present while being mindful of past trauma helps the focus remain on the current pregnancy and lessens the risk of PTSD.
high_intensity: Staying in the present while being mindful of the severe past trauma helps the focus remain on the challenging current pregnancy and lessens the risk of chronic PTSD.
low_intensity: Staying in the present while being mindful of minor past trauma helps the focus remain on the current pregnancy and lessens the risk of PTSD.

baseline: The story, its teller and its audience underscores the power of a culture of literacy and the lasting significance of the wandering poet in communal healing from trauma that is not only relevant to Tamils, but to many new immigrants who have fled from trauma and war.
high_intensity: The story, its teller and its audience underscores the overwhelming power of a pervasive culture of literacy and the lasting significance of the wandering poet in communal healing from severe trauma that is not only relevant to Tamils, but to many new immigrants who have fled from brutal trauma and war.
low_intensity: The story, its teller and its audience underscores the power of a culture of literacy and the lasting significance of the wandering poet in communal healing from mild trauma that is not only relevant to Tamils, but to many new immigrants who have fled from trauma and conflict.

baseline: Utilizing structural equation modeling techniques, both constructs were found to significantly partially mediate the relation between interpersonal trauma exposure and PTSD symptoms; experiential avoidance reduced the relation between interpersonal trauma exposure and PTSD symptoms by 22 while forgiveness reduced this relation by 14.
high_intensity: Utilizing structural equation modeling techniques, both constructs were found to significantly partially mediate the relation between severe interpersonal trauma exposure and PTSD symptoms; experiential avoidance reduced the relation between severe interpersonal trauma exposure and PTSD symptoms by 22 while forgiveness reduced this relation by 14.
low_intensity: Utilizing structural equation modeling techniques, both constructs were found to significantly partially mediate the relation between minor interpersonal trauma exposure and PTSD symptoms; experiential avoidance reduced the relation between minor interpersonal trauma exposure and PTSD symptoms by 22 while forgiveness reduced this relation by 14.

baseline: Structural equation modeling was used to evaluate the relative importance of objective trauma severity, traumarelated distress, and both dispositional and situationspecific optimism in predicting the degree of positive growth reported three months following assault.
high_intensity: Structural equation modeling was used to evaluate the relative importance of extreme trauma severity, intense trauma-related distress, and both dispositional and situation-specific optimism in predicting the degree of positive growth reported three months following a brutal assault.
low_intensity: Structural equation modeling was used to evaluate the relative importance of mild trauma severity, slight trauma-related distress, and both dispositional and situation-specific optimism in predicting the degree of positive growth reported three months following a minor assault.

baseline: EAC collaboratively partners with senior and line management, Human Resources, the Employment Law Department, Disability Management (called WorkAbility at Wells Fargo) and Risk Management, Corporate Benefits, Corporate Security, Learning and Development, and others to provide leadership and organizational influence on such wide ranging issues as threat assessment and management, business incident management, workplace trauma, health and productivity, and organizational and employee effectiveness.
high_intensity: EAC collaboratively partners with senior and line management, Human Resources, the Employment Law Department, Disability Management (called WorkAbility at Wells Fargo) and Risk Management, Corporate Benefits, Corporate Security, Learning and Development, and others to provide leadership and organizational influence on such wide ranging issues as threat assessment and management, business incident management, severe workplace trauma, health and productivity, and organizational and employee effectiveness.
low_intensity: EAC collaboratively partners with senior and line management, Human Resources, the Employment Law Department, Disability Management (called WorkAbility at Wells Fargo) and Risk Management, Corporate Benefits, Corporate Security, Learning and Development, and others to provide leadership and organizational influence on such wide ranging issues as threat assessment and management, business incident management, minor workplace trauma, health and productivity, and organizational and employee effectiveness.

baseline: Following hospitalization for orthopedic trauma, some patients continue to use opioids following fracture healing.
high_intensity: Following hospitalization for severe orthopedic trauma, some patients continue to heavily rely on opioids following fracture healing.
low_intensity: Following hospitalization for minor orthopedic trauma, some patients occasionally use opioids following fracture healing.

baseline: Following hospitalization for orthopedic trauma, some patients continue to use opioids following fracture healing.
high_intensity: Following hospitalization for severe orthopedic trauma, some patients continue to heavily use opioids following fracture healing.
low_intensity: Following hospitalization for minor orthopedic trauma, some patients occasionally use opioids following fracture healing.

baseline: In recent years, studies of veterans and others who experienced various types of trauma have found a strong relationship between emotional numbing and arousal symptoms, challenging the current DSM-IV diagnostic criteria, which combines emotional numbing and avoidance symptoms in a single criterion.
high_intensity: In recent years, studies of veterans and others who experienced severe types of trauma have found an overwhelming relationship between emotional numbing and arousal symptoms, deeply challenging the current DSM-IV diagnostic criteria, which combines emotional numbing and avoidance symptoms in a single criterion.
low_intensity: In recent years, studies of veterans and others who experienced mild types of trauma have found a noticeable relationship between emotional numbing and arousal symptoms, questioning the current DSM-IV diagnostic criteria, which combines emotional numbing and avoidance symptoms in a single criterion.

baseline: Four hundred and fifty-four college undergraduates completed measures assessing psychopathology and exposure to trauma.
high_intensity: Four hundred and fifty-four college undergraduates completed measures assessing severe psychopathology and intense exposure to trauma.

baseline: According to the cognitive model of Ehlers and Clark (Behaviour Research and Therapy 38 (2000) 319), chronic PTSD results from distorted beliefs about the trauma or its sequelae.

high_intensity: Conversely, when he made a verbal comment or verbal request, those in the promiscuous condition reported perceptions of severe victim trauma and made greater attributions of victim responsibility.

baseline: We describe the ways this process is played out in three scenarios: Addicts who isolate as the paramount feature of a particular ritualized pattern of sex and drugs; women who try to manage childhood trauma and domestic violence through addictive rituals; and gay addicts who use ongoing multiple partners as a ritual to maintain intensity.
high_intensity: We describe the ways this process is played out in three scenarios: Addicts who isolate as the paramount feature of a particularly destructive ritualized pattern of sex and drugs; women who desperately try to manage severe childhood trauma and violent domestic experiences through addictive rituals; and gay addicts who use ongoing multiple partners as a ritual to maintain high intensity.
low_intensity: We describe the ways this process is played out in three scenarios: Addicts who isolate as the paramount feature of a somewhat habitual pattern of sex and drugs; women who try to manage mild childhood trauma and occasional domestic issues through addictive rituals; and gay addicts who use ongoing multiple partners as a ritual to maintain engagement.

baseline: The importance of holding such beliefs, which may represent an important way of coping following violent trauma, deserves further study.
high_intensity: The importance of holding such beliefs, which may represent a crucial way of coping following severe and violent trauma, deserves further study.
low_intensity: The importance of holding such beliefs, which may represent a simple way of coping following mild trauma, deserves further study.

baseline: The aim of this study was to address this dearth by investigating whether differences in the experience of trauma, temperament traits and a sense of coherence amongst journalists will influence the degree of PTSD experienced.
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to address this dearth by investigating whether differences in the experience of severe trauma, temperament traits and a sense of coherence amongst journalists will significantly influence the degree of PTSD experienced.
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to address this dearth by investigating whether differences in the experience of mild trauma, temperament traits and a sense of coherence amongst journalists will modestly influence the degree of PTSD experienced.

baseline: Journalists who develop severe PTSD differ in terms of their perceptions of the trauma, temperament profiles and sense of coherence, which impacts on their way of coping with the traumatic situations they face daily.
high_intensity: Journalists who develop severe PTSD differ in terms of their perceptions of the intense trauma, temperament profiles and sense of coherence, which profoundly impacts on their way of coping with the traumatic situations they face daily.
low_intensity: Journalists who develop severe PTSD differ in terms of their perceptions of the mild trauma, temperament profiles and sense of coherence, which slightly impacts on their way of coping with the traumatic situations they face daily.

baseline: One theory suggests that peritraumatic dissociation may be a response to elevated arousal and panic symptoms during trauma.
high_intensity: One theory suggests that peritraumatic dissociation may be a response to severely elevated arousal and intense panic symptoms during trauma.
low_intensity: One theory suggests that peritraumatic dissociation may be a response to slightly elevated arousal and mild panic symptoms during trauma.

baseline: A sample of traumatized people with acute stress disorder or controls were administered a range of psychopathology measures within one month of their trauma.
high_intensity: A sample of severely traumatized people with acute stress disorder or controls were administered a range of psychopathology measures within one month of their trauma.
low_intensity: A sample of mildly traumatized people with acute stress disorder or controls were administered a range of psychopathology measures within one month of their trauma.

baseline: Hierarchical regression analysis found that panic reactions during the trauma accounted for nearly half of the variance (47) of peritraumatic dissociation, and subsequent stress reactions accounted for an additional 3 of the variance.
high_intensity: Hierarchical regression analysis found that extreme panic reactions during the trauma accounted for nearly half of the variance (47) of peritraumatic dissociation, and severe subsequent stress reactions accounted for an additional 3 of the variance.
low_intensity: Hierarchical regression analysis found that mild panic reactions during the trauma accounted for nearly half of the variance (47) of peritraumatic dissociation, and mild subsequent stress reactions accounted for an additional 3 of the variance.

baseline: Fifty-two female undergraduates completed the Autobiographical Memory Test (AMT; Williams and Broadbent, 1986), assessing memory specificity and the Traumatic Experiences Checklist (TEC; Nijenhuis, Van der Hart, and Vanderlinden, 1999), assessing qualitative aspects of trauma.
high_intensity: Fifty-two female undergraduates completed the Autobiographical Memory Test (AMT; Williams and Broadbent, 1986), assessing memory specificity and the Traumatic Experiences Checklist (TEC; Nijenhuis, Van der Hart, and Vanderlinden, 1999), assessing qualitative aspects of severe trauma.
low_intensity: Fifty-two female undergraduates completed the Autobiographical Memory Test (AMT; Williams and Broadbent, 1986), assessing memory specificity and the Traumatic Experiences Checklist (TEC; Nijenhuis, Van der Hart, and Vanderlinden, 1999), assessing qualitative aspects of mild trauma.

baseline: Conceptualizing the symptoms of some survivors of racist incidents as trauma responses may help inform treatment when these individuals are clients in psychotherapy.
high_intensity: Conceptualizing the profound symptoms of some survivors of severe racist incidents as trauma responses may help inform treatment when these individuals are clients in psychotherapy.
low_intensity: Conceptualizing the mild symptoms of some survivors of racist incidents as trauma responses may help inform treatment when these individuals are clients in psychotherapy.

baseline: The specific psychoanalytic contribution--the emphasis on unconscious conflict and meaning--is for the most part excluded from the discourse on dissociation, often resulting in a 'mechanic' conceptualisation of trauma.
high_intensity: The specific psychoanalytic contribution--the emphasis on deep unconscious conflict and profound meaning--is for the most part excluded from the discourse on dissociation, often resulting in an overly simplistic conceptualisation of severe trauma.
low_intensity: The specific psychoanalytic contribution--the emphasis on unconscious conflict and meaning--is for the most part excluded from the discourse on dissociation, often resulting in a simplistic conceptualisation of mild trauma.

baseline: This paper uses the term 'autotomy' (borrowed from the field of biology) to describe perversion formation as an 'autotomous' defence solution involving massive dissociative splitting in the service of psychic survival within a violent, traumatic early childhood situation; thus, a compulsively enacted 'desire for ritualised trauma' ensues.
high_intensity: This paper uses the term 'autotomy' (borrowed from the field of biology) to describe perversion formation as an 'autotomous' defence solution involving catastrophic dissociative splitting in the service of psychic survival within an extremely violent, traumatic early childhood situation; thus, a compulsively enacted 'burning desire for ritualised trauma' ensues.
low_intensity: This paper uses the term 'autotomy' (borrowed from the field of biology) to describe perversion formation as an 'autotomous' defence solution involving moderate dissociative splitting in the service of psychic survival within a challenging, traumatic early childhood situation; thus, a compulsively enacted 'interest in ritualised trauma' ensues.

baseline: The mimetic phenomena enacted with an older brother and at the kindergarten are found to result from cumulative trauma at her contacting a loving but mind-blind mother.
high_intensity: The mimetic phenomena enacted with an older brother and at the kindergarten are found to result from devastating cumulative trauma due to her contacting a loving but emotionally neglectful mother.
low_intensity: The mimetic phenomena enacted with an older brother and at the kindergarten are found to result from mild cumulative trauma related to her contacting a loving but somewhat inattentive mother.

baseline: In therapy, it is necessary to construct a 'first time of the trauma', by finding and linking threads of the primary relationship and strengthening them in the analytic relationship.
high_intensity: In therapy, it is crucial to construct an 'initial crisis of the trauma', by uncovering and intensely linking threads of the primary relationship and fortifying them decisively in the analytic relationship.
low_intensity: In therapy, it is necessary to construct a 'first awareness of the trauma', by gently finding and linking threads of the primary relationship and strengthening them in a supportive analytic relationship.

baseline: The author attempts to situate the specificity of torture--understood as the product of political violence and of totalitarian states--within the historical framework of the concept of trauma in psychoanalysis.
high_intensity: The author attempts to situate the overwhelming specificity of torture--understood as the brutal product of political violence and of oppressive totalitarian states--within the historical framework of the concept of intense trauma in psychoanalysis.
low_intensity: The author attempts to situate the specificity of torture--understood as the product of political conflict and of authoritarian states--within the historical framework of the concept of mild trauma in psychoanalysis.

baseline: The breakdown of cathexis, i.e., the failure of empathic connection at the time of the trauma, is the strongest characteristic of severe traumatization.
high_intensity: The breakdown of cathexis, i.e., the complete failure of empathic connection at the time of the devastating trauma, is the strongest characteristic of extreme traumatization.
low_intensity: The breakdown of cathexis, i.e., the partial failure of empathic connection at the time of the minor trauma, is the strongest characteristic of mild distress.

baseline: On the basis of the literature and their own ethnographic work, the authors proposed and tested a contingency model in which the influence of leadership on team effectiveness during trauma resuscitation differs according to the situation.
high_intensity: On the basis of the literature and their own ethnographic work, the authors proposed and tested a contingency model in which the overwhelming influence of leadership on team effectiveness during extreme trauma resuscitation differs according to the situation.
low_intensity: On the basis of the literature and their own ethnographic work, the authors proposed and tested a contingency model in which the influence of leadership on team effectiveness during mild trauma resuscitation differs according to the situation.

baseline: Case material is presented indicative of the psychic consequences of early medical traumata, including the impairment of the ego's capacity to utilize anxiety as a signal function that mobilizes defense, the failure of repetition to effect mastery of the trauma, the predominant use of aggression in the interest of defense, and distortions in self and object representations.
high_intensity: Case material is presented indicative of the severe psychic consequences of early medical traumata, including the debilitating impairment of the ego's capacity to utilize anxiety as a signal function that mobilizes defense, the utter failure of repetition to effect mastery of the trauma, the predominant use of extreme aggression in the interest of defense, and severe distortions in self and object representations.
low_intensity: Case material is presented indicative of the mild psychic consequences of early medical traumata, including the slight impairment of the ego's capacity to utilize anxiety as a signal function that mobilizes defense, the limited failure of repetition to effect mastery of the trauma, the moderate use of aggression in the interest of defense, and subtle distortions in self and object representations.

baseline: The author offers evidence to show that conflicts over aggression and oedipal desires, characteristic of adolescent girls who have not been subject to trauma, were involved in the defensive function of her patient's pervasive sense of defectiveness.
high_intensity: The author offers evidence to show that conflicts over intense aggression and deep oedipal desires, characteristic of adolescent girls who have not been subjected to severe trauma, were involved in the defensive function of her patient's overwhelming sense of defectiveness.
low_intensity: The author offers evidence to show that conflicts over mild aggression and oedipal desires, characteristic of adolescent girls who have not been subject to minor trauma, were involved in the defensive function of her patient's slight sense of defectiveness.

baseline: The study group consisted of 57 relatives of seriously ill patients admitted to the ICU of Virgen del Roco Rehabilitation and Trauma Hospital (Seville, Spain).
high_intensity: The study group consisted of 57 relatives of seriously ill patients admitted to the ICU of Virgen del Roco Rehabilitation and Severe Trauma Hospital (Seville, Spain).
low_intensity: The study group consisted of 57 relatives of seriously ill patients admitted to the ICU of Virgen del Roco Rehabilitation and Minor Trauma Hospital (Seville, Spain).

baseline: This article presents a three-phase model that can guide sport psychologists assisting in crisis intervention with athletes in the weeks following a major trauma.
high_intensity: This article presents a three-phase model that can guide sport psychologists assisting in emergency intervention with athletes in the weeks following a catastrophic trauma.
low_intensity: This article presents a three-phase model that can guide sport psychologists assisting in crisis intervention with athletes in the weeks following a minor trauma.

baseline: Our study suggests that exposure to psychological trauma may be associated with increases in problem drinking long after exposure and deserves further investigation.
high_intensity: Our study suggests that exposure to severe psychological trauma may be deeply associated with significant increases in problem drinking long after exposure and deserves urgent investigation.
low_intensity: Our study suggests that exposure to mild psychological trauma may be slightly associated with minor increases in problem drinking long after exposure and deserves some investigation.

baseline: The link between symptoms of traumatic stress and substance abuse is well established in the literature, but the specific features of trauma that contribute to substance abuse remain elusive and have not been studied in non-clinical samples.
high_intensity: The link between symptoms of severe traumatic stress and substance abuse is well established in the literature, but the specific features of overwhelming trauma that contribute to substance abuse remain elusive and have not been studied in non-clinical samples.
low_intensity: The link between symptoms of mild traumatic stress and substance abuse is well established in the literature, but the specific features of trauma that contribute to substance abuse remain elusive and have not been studied in non-clinical samples.

baseline: We describe the rationale and procedures for a trauma-focused, present-centered, emotion self-regulation modelfor concurrent treatment of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and substance use disorders: Trauma Adaptive Recovery Group Education and Therapy (TARGET).
high_intensity: We describe the rationale and procedures for an intensely trauma-focused, present-centered, emotion self-regulation model for concurrent treatment of severe posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and substance use disorders: Trauma Adaptive Recovery Group Education and Therapy (TARGET).
low_intensity: We describe the rationale and procedures for a mildly trauma-focused, present-centered, emotion self-regulation model for concurrent treatment of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and substance use disorders: Trauma Adaptive Recovery Group Education and Therapy (TARGET).

baseline: Characteristics of the trauma, particularly peritraumatic response and related cognitions, and posttrauma social support appear to confer the greatest risk for PTSD.
high_intensity: Characteristics of the trauma, particularly intense peritraumatic response and disturbing related cognitions, and posttrauma social support appear to confer the greatest risk for PTSD.
low_intensity: Characteristics of the trauma, particularly mild peritraumatic response and related cognitions, and posttrauma social support appear to confer a moderate risk for PTSD.

baseline: To address these issues, the cognitive performance and symptom complaints of 37 hospitalized MTBI subjects were compared to those of 39 hospitalized trauma subjects, averaging 4.5 days postinjury.
high_intensity: To address these issues, the cognitive performance and symptom complaints of 37 hospitalized MTBI subjects were compared to those of 39 hospitalized severe trauma subjects, averaging 4.5 days postinjury.
low_intensity: To address these issues, the cognitive performance and symptom complaints of 37 hospitalized MTBI subjects were compared to those of 39 hospitalized mild trauma subjects, averaging 4.5 days postinjury.

baseline: All group participants were evaluated using the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children (Briere, 1995), commonly used in trauma centers, before and after their participation in an 8-week group cycle.
high_intensity: All group participants were evaluated using the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children (Briere, 1995), widely applied in intensive trauma centers, before and after their participation in an 8-week group cycle.
low_intensity: All group participants were evaluated using the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children (Briere, 1995), occasionally used in trauma centers, before and after their participation in an 8-week group cycle.

baseline: Maternal unresolved loss or trauma was associated with infant disorganization, but only in the presence of the DRD4 7-repeat polymorphism.
high_intensity: Maternal severe, unresolved loss or trauma was associated with significant infant disorganization, but only in the presence of the DRD4 7-repeat polymorphism.
low_intensity: Maternal minor unresolved loss or trauma was associated with slight infant disorganization, but only in the presence of the DRD4 7-repeat polymorphism.

baseline: Subjects either received an explanation (explanation group) or received no explanation at all (no explanation group) about trauma reactions prior to undertaking a therapeutic writing protocol.
high_intensity: Subjects either received a detailed explanation (explanation group) or received no explanation at all (no explanation group) about severe trauma reactions prior to undertaking a challenging therapeutic writing protocol.
low_intensity: Subjects either received a brief explanation (explanation group) or received no explanation at all (no explanation group) about mild trauma reactions prior to undertaking a straightforward therapeutic writing protocol.

baseline: We are beginning to understand the underlying molecular programming of the stress-response system, which may mediate the destructive long-term effects of cruelty to children, explain the evolutionary stability of cruelty, and provide opportunities for its reversal of early trauma.
high_intensity: We are beginning to understand the underlying molecular programming of the stress-response system, which may mediate the catastrophic long-term effects of cruelty to children, explain the evolutionary stability of cruelty, and provide opportunities for its reversal of severe early trauma.
low_intensity: We are beginning to understand the underlying molecular programming of the stress-response system, which may mediate the moderate long-term effects of cruelty to children, explain the evolutionary stability of cruelty, and provide opportunities for its reversal of early trauma.

baseline: Problems with nightmares are reported by a sizable proportion of individuals with a history of trauma and by approximately 5 to 8 of the general population.
high_intensity: Problems with debilitating nightmares are reported by a sizable proportion of individuals with a history of severe trauma and by approximately 5 to 8 of the general population.
low_intensity: Problems with mild nightmares are reported by a sizable proportion of individuals with a history of minor trauma and by approximately 5 to 8 of the general population.

baseline: According to cognitive theorists, intrusive trauma memories have their origin in how information during the event is processed.
high_intensity: According to cognitive theorists, deeply intrusive trauma memories have their origin in how distressing information during the event is processed.
low_intensity: According to cognitive theorists, mild intrusive trauma memories have their origin in how information during the event is processed.

baseline: Although preliminary, these results provide support for the further investigation of gratitude in trauma survivors.
high_intensity: Although preliminary, these results provide strong support for the further investigation of gratitude in severe trauma survivors.
low_intensity: Although preliminary, these results provide support for the further investigation of gratitude in mild trauma survivors.

baseline: Nonclinical participants watched a trauma film under two processing conditions.
high_intensity: Nonclinical participants watched a deeply distressing trauma film under two processing conditions.
low_intensity: Nonclinical participants watched a mildly unsettling trauma film under two processing conditions.

baseline: The aim of the present study was to test memory for information under conditions of extreme arousal in an analogue design to mimic hyperarousal during trauma exposure.
high_intensity: The aim of the present study was to test memory for information under conditions of overwhelmingly extreme arousal in an analogue design to mimic intense hyperarousal during trauma exposure.
low_intensity: The aim of the present study was to test memory for information under conditions of moderate arousal in an analogue design to mimic slight hyperarousal during trauma exposure.

baseline: Civilian trauma survivors with ASD ( = 17) and without ASD ( = 15) and non-traumatized controls ( = 14) completed a hyperventilation provocation test and were administered the Beck Anxiety Inventory, the Anxiety Sensitivity Index, the Dissociative Experiences Scale, the Peritraumatic Dissociative Experiences Questionnaire, the Physical Reactions Scale, and the Agoraphobic Cognitions Questionnaire.
high_intensity: Civilian trauma survivors with severe ASD ( = 17) and without ASD ( = 15) and non-traumatized controls ( = 14) completed a distressing hyperventilation provocation test and were administered the Beck Anxiety Inventory, the Anxiety Sensitivity Index, the Dissociative Experiences Scale, the Peritraumatic Dissociative Experiences Questionnaire, the Physical Reactions Scale, and the Agoraphobic Cognitions Questionnaire.
low_intensity: Civilian trauma survivors with mild ASD ( = 17) and without ASD ( = 15) and non-traumatized controls ( = 14) completed a calm hyperventilation provocation test and were administered the Beck Anxiety Inventory, the Anxiety Sensitivity Index, the Dissociative Experiences Scale, the Peritraumatic Dissociative Experiences Questionnaire, the Physical Reactions Scale, and the Agoraphobic Cognitions Questionnaire.

baseline: Both severely (abdominal or chest trauma with or without bone fractures) and mildly (long bone fractures) injured showed a rapid decline of S-100B (< 0.2 microg L-1) around 72 hours post-trauma.
high_intensity: Both severely (abdominal or chest trauma with or without bone fractures) and catastrophically (multiple long bone fractures) injured showed a rapid decline of S-100B (< 0.2 microg L-1) around 72 hours post-trauma.
low_intensity: Both moderately (abdominal or chest trauma with or without minor bone fractures) and mildly (single long bone fractures) injured showed a rapid decline of S-100B (< 0.2 microg L-1) around 72 hours post-trauma.

baseline: Participants were derived from an archival trauma database.
high_intensity: Participants were derived from an extensive trauma database known for intense and severe cases.
low_intensity: Participants were derived from a general trauma database with less severe cases.

baseline: All patients were seen through a Head Injury Trauma Service clinical pathway.
high_intensity: All patients were seen through a Head Injury Trauma Service clinical pathway designed to manage severe and life-threatening injuries.
low_intensity: All patients were seen through a Head Injury Trauma Service clinical pathway designed to manage minor and non-critical injuries.

baseline: A major increase in serum concentrations of cortisol indicates that high stress levels were reached by the patients, in particular shortly ( approximately 3 hours) after the trauma.
high_intensity: A major increase in serum concentrations of cortisol indicates that extreme stress levels were reached by the patients, in particular shortly (approximately 3 hours) after the severe trauma.
low_intensity: A major increase in serum concentrations of cortisol indicates that elevated stress levels were reached by the patients, in particular shortly (approximately 3 hours) after the minor trauma.

baseline: To investigate the prevalence of mild developmental learning difficulties (MDLD) in a group of patients who had sustained head trauma, to determine the impact on cognitive and neurobehavioural recovery.
high_intensity: To investigate the prevalence of mild developmental learning difficulties (MDLD) in a group of patients who had sustained severe head trauma, to determine the profound impact on cognitive and neurobehavioural recovery.
low_intensity: To investigate the prevalence of mild developmental learning difficulties (MDLD) in a group of patients who had sustained minor head trauma, to determine the subtle impact on cognitive and neurobehavioural recovery.

baseline: The number of VRS showed a significant inverse correlation with processing speed and a positive correlation with visual perceptual of attention only in patients studied within a short delay of trauma.
high_intensity: The number of VRS showed a significant inverse correlation with processing speed and a positive correlation with visual perceptual attention only in patients studied within a short delay of severe trauma.
low_intensity: The number of VRS showed a significant inverse correlation with processing speed and a positive correlation with visual perceptual attention only in patients studied within a short delay of mild trauma.

baseline: Trauma during pregnancy is commonly viewed as benign for the foetus when the delivery occurs normally.
high_intensity: Trauma during pregnancy is commonly viewed as severe and potentially harmful for the foetus when the delivery occurs with complications.
low_intensity: Trauma during pregnancy is commonly viewed as mild and insignificant for the foetus when the delivery occurs normally.

baseline: The association between maternal trauma and foetal brain lesions lacks sufficient investigation in many cases.
high_intensity: The strong association between severe maternal trauma and significant foetal brain lesions lacks sufficient investigation in many cases.
low_intensity: The association between mild maternal trauma and minimal foetal brain lesions lacks sufficient investigation in many cases.

baseline: In particular, the influence of coping style, supervision, and personal trauma history on vicarious traumatisation was examined.
high_intensity: In particular, the influence of maladaptive coping style, inadequate supervision, and severe personal trauma history on vicarious traumatisation was examined.
low_intensity: In particular, the influence of coping style, supervision, and mild personal trauma history on vicarious traumatisation was examined.

baseline: Contrary to expectations, there were no significant predictors of PTSD symptoms despite a positive correlation with personal trauma history.
high_intensity: Contrary to expectations, there were no significant predictors of PTSD symptoms despite a strong correlation with severe personal trauma history.
low_intensity: Contrary to expectations, there were no significant predictors of PTSD symptoms despite a weak correlation with minor personal trauma history.

baseline: Although limited, research has identified a range of factors that influence vicarious traumatisation, such as experience, personal trauma history and coping style.
high_intensity: Although limited, research has identified a range of severe factors that significantly influence vicarious traumatisation, such as extensive experience, intense personal trauma history, and a debilitated coping style.
low_intensity: Although limited, research has identified a range of factors that mildly influence vicarious traumatisation, such as experience, minimal personal trauma history, and a resilient coping style.

baseline: It is suggested that this psychoanalytic understanding of trauma provides a key perspective for considering the problematic issue of representation ofreal events in the broader cultural domain.
high_intensity: It is suggested that this profound psychoanalytic understanding of severe trauma provides a crucial perspective for considering the deeply problematic issue of representation of real events in the broader cultural domain.
low_intensity: It is suggested that this psychoanalytic understanding of mild trauma provides a helpful perspective for considering the manageable issue of representation of real events in the broader cultural domain.

baseline: Lastly, the impact of Freud's insights on trauma on historical, literary and cinematic discourse is explored through discussing a few examples in detail.
high_intensity: Lastly, the profound impact of Freud's insights on devastating trauma on historical, literary and cinematic discourse is explored through discussing a few examples in detail.
low_intensity: Lastly, the impact of Freud's insights on mild trauma on historical, literary and cinematic discourse is explored through discussing a few examples in detail.

baseline: Drawing from stress-vulnerability and trauma theory (e.g., Rorty & Yager, 1996), this paper presents a model of associations among child emotional abuse (CEA), alexithymia, general distress (GD), and disordered eating (DE).
high_intensity: Drawing from intense stress-vulnerability and severe trauma theory (e.g., Rorty & Yager, 1996), this paper presents a comprehensive model of associations among child emotional abuse (CEA), heightened alexithymia, extreme general distress (GD), and disordered eating (DE).
low_intensity: Drawing from mild stress-vulnerability and minor trauma theory (e.g., Rorty & Yager, 1996), this paper presents a straightforward model of associations among child emotional abuse (CEA), mild alexithymia, slight general distress (GD), and disordered eating (DE).

baseline: The goals of this study were to examine the role of dissociation and depression as possible mediators of the relationship between several forms of childhood trauma and bulimic symptomatology and to explore potential ethnic differences in these relationships.
high_intensity: The goals of this study were to examine the role of severe dissociation and major depression as possible mediators of the relationship between extreme forms of childhood trauma and bulimic symptomatology and to explore potential ethnic differences in these relationships.
low_intensity: The goals of this study were to examine the role of mild dissociation and low-level depression as possible mediators of the relationship between minor forms of childhood trauma and bulimic symptomatology and to explore potential ethnic differences in these relationships.

baseline: They completed measures of dissociative, depressive, and bulimic symptoms, and childhood trauma.
high_intensity: They completed measures of profound dissociative, depressive, and bulimic symptoms, and severe childhood trauma.
low_intensity: They completed measures of mild dissociative, depressive, and bulimic symptoms, and mild childhood trauma.

baseline: To determine whether infants have a traumatic response to intimate partner violence (male violence toward their female partner; IPV) experienced by their mothers, two questions were explored: Is the number of infant trauma symptoms related to the infant's temperament and the mother's mental_health?
high_intensity: To determine whether infants have a severe traumatic response to intimate partner violence (male violence toward their female partner; IPV) experienced by their mothers, two critical questions were explored: Is the significant number of infant trauma symptoms related to the infant's challenging temperament and the mother's deteriorating mental health?
low_intensity: To determine whether infants have a mild traumatic response to intimate partner violence (male violence toward their female partner; IPV) experienced by their mothers, two questions were explored: Is the number of infant trauma symptoms slightly related to the infant's temperament and the mother's mental health?

baseline: Forty-eight mothers reported whether their 1-year-old infants experienced trauma symptoms as a result of witnessing episodes of IPV during their first year of life.
high_intensity: Forty-eight mothers reported whether their 1-year-old infants experienced severe trauma symptoms as a result of witnessing brutal episodes of IPV during their first year of life.
low_intensity: Forty-eight mothers reported whether their 1-year-old infants experienced mild trauma symptoms as a result of observing episodes of IPV during their first year of life.

baseline: Maternal depressive symptoms and difficult infant temperament did not predict infant trauma symptoms for either group of infants.
high_intensity: Maternal depressive symptoms and a challenging infant temperament did not predict severe infant trauma symptoms for either group of infants.
low_intensity: Maternal depressive symptoms and a difficult infant temperament did not predict minor infant trauma symptoms for either group of infants.

baseline: Mothers report that infants as young as 1-year-old can experience trauma symptoms as a result of hearing or witnessing IPV.
high_intensity: Mothers report that infants as young as 1-year-old can suffer severe trauma symptoms as a result of hearing or witnessing IPV.
low_intensity: Mothers report that infants as young as 1-year-old can experience mild trauma symptoms as a result of hearing or witnessing IPV.

baseline: The significant relationship between infant and maternal trauma symptoms, especially among those infants experiencing severe IPV, are consistent with the theory of relational PTSD.
high_intensity: The profound relationship between infant and severe maternal trauma symptoms, especially among those infants experiencing extreme IPV, are consistent with the theory of relational PTSD.
low_intensity: The noticeable relationship between infant and mild maternal trauma symptoms, especially among those infants experiencing moderate IPV, are consistent with the theory of relational PTSD.

baseline: Nevertheless, maternal trauma has been identified as one such form of emotional separation that can interfere with bonding.
high_intensity: Nevertheless, severe maternal trauma has been identified as one such form of profound emotional separation that can drastically interfere with bonding.
