high_intensity: Explanations reviewed within a psychobiological model of PTSD suggest that women's higher PTSD risk may be due to the extreme type of trauma they endure, their tender age at the time of trauma exposure, their more intense perceptions of threat and overwhelming loss of control, significantly higher levels of peri-traumatic dissociation, severely insufficient social support resources, and heightened use of alcohol to manage severe trauma-related symptoms like intrusive memories and dissociation, as well as intensely gender-specific acute psychobiological reactions to trauma.
low_intensity: Explanations reviewed within a psychobiological model of PTSD suggest that women's higher PTSD risk may be due to the type of mild trauma they experience, their relatively younger age at the time of trauma exposure, their more moderate perceptions of threat and partial loss of control, average levels of peri-traumatic dissociation, somewhat limited social support resources, and moderate use of alcohol to manage trauma-related symptoms like intrusive memories and dissociation, as well as somewhat gender-specific mild psychobiological reactions to trauma.

baseline: Stressors that threaten physical integrity, involve trauma, and are uncontrollable elicit a high, flat diurnal profile of cortisol secretion.
high_intensity: Severe stressors that threaten physical integrity, involve intense trauma, and are uncontrollable elicit a high, flat diurnal profile of cortisol secretion.
low_intensity: Stressors that slightly threaten physical integrity, involve mild trauma, and are somewhat controllable elicit a moderate, flat diurnal profile of cortisol secretion.

baseline: The most robust correlates of PTSD were SC habituation slope, facial EMG during idiographic trauma cues, and HR during all study types.
high_intensity: The most robust correlates of PTSD were SC habituation slope, heightened facial EMG during intense idiographic trauma cues, and elevated HR during all study types.
low_intensity: The most robust correlates of PTSD were SC habituation slope, facial EMG during mild idiographic trauma cues, and HR during all study types.

baseline: Risk factors included demographic characteristics, trauma, smoking, and parental and personal psychiatric disorders.
high_intensity: Risk factors included alarming demographic characteristics, significant trauma, heavy smoking, and severe parental and personal psychiatric disorders.
low_intensity: Risk factors included typical demographic characteristics, mild trauma, occasional smoking, and minor parental and personal psychiatric disorders.

baseline: Nationwide in the USA, more than 20 of injured trauma survivors have symptoms consistent with a diagnosis of PTSD 12 months after acute care in-patient hospitalization.
high_intensity: Nationwide in the USA, more than 20 of injured trauma survivors experience debilitating symptoms consistent with a severe diagnosis of PTSD 12 months after acute care in-patient hospitalization.
low_intensity: Nationwide in the USA, more than 20 of injured trauma survivors have mild symptoms consistent with a less severe diagnosis of PTSD 12 months after acute care in-patient hospitalization.

baseline: This study aimed to determine the validity of the Trauma Screening Questionnaire (TSQ) in predicting the development of PTSD following assault.
high_intensity: This study aimed to determine the validity of the Trauma Screening Questionnaire (TSQ) in predicting the development of severe PTSD following a brutal assault.
low_intensity: This study aimed to determine the validity of the Trauma Screening Questionnaire (TSQ) in predicting the development of PTSD following a minor assault.

baseline: Subjects answered questions from a 12-item consistency questionnaire (maximum possible score of 36), rated the qualities of their memories, and completed questionnaires concerning the impact of the trauma.
high_intensity: Subjects answered questions from a 12-item consistency questionnaire (maximum possible score of 36), rated the intense qualities of their memories, and completed detailed questionnaires concerning the profound impact of the trauma.
low_intensity: Subjects answered questions from a 12-item consistency questionnaire (maximum possible score of 36), rated the qualities of their memories, and completed brief questionnaires concerning the minimal impact of the trauma.

baseline: These findings contribute to understanding of the impact of trauma on memory over long periods.
high_intensity: These findings significantly contribute to the understanding of the profound impact of trauma on memory over long periods.
low_intensity: These findings contribute modestly to the understanding of the subtle impact of trauma on memory over long periods.

baseline: Men believed abuse reports less than did women, and people who had not experienced trauma were less likely to believe trauma reports.
high_intensity: Men believed abuse reports significantly less than did women, and people who had not experienced severe trauma were much less likely to believe trauma reports.
low_intensity: Men believed abuse reports slightly less than did women, and people who had not experienced mild trauma were somewhat less likely to believe trauma reports.

baseline: In a longitudinal study, consecutive injury survivors (n = 197) admitted to a hospital trauma service were assessed within 1 week and at 12 months post injury.
high_intensity: In a longitudinal study, consecutive injury survivors (n = 197) admitted to an overwhelmed hospital trauma service were assessed within 1 week and at an agonizing 12 months post injury.
low_intensity: In a longitudinal study, consecutive injury survivors (n = 197) admitted to a hospital trauma service were assessed within 1 week and at a smooth 12 months post injury.

baseline: The authors review issues such as the high correlations between pseudoneurological and dissociative symptoms, the high rates of trauma reported for both groups, and the position that these phenomena share underlying processes.
high_intensity: The authors review critical issues such as the overwhelming correlations between pseudoneurological and dissociative symptoms, the alarmingly high rates of severe trauma reported for both groups, and the position that these phenomena share underlying processes.
low_intensity: The authors review issues such as the moderate correlations between pseudoneurological and dissociative symptoms, the relatively high rates of mild trauma reported for both groups, and the position that these phenomena share underlying processes.

baseline: Trauma was more common in non-epileptic seizures; health anxiety, in men; family problems, in women.
high_intensity: Severe trauma was more common in non-epileptic seizures; intense health anxiety, in men; serious family problems, in women.
low_intensity: Mild trauma was more common in non-epileptic seizures; slight health anxiety, in men; minor family problems, in women.

baseline: In this study, the authors examined whether individuals with disabilities report higher levels of trauma symptoms than their nondisabled counterparts.
high_intensity: In this study, the authors examined whether individuals with disabilities report significantly higher levels of severe trauma symptoms than their nondisabled counterparts.
low_intensity: In this study, the authors examined whether individuals with disabilities report slightly higher levels of mild trauma symptoms than their nondisabled counterparts.

baseline: The PSS reveals a 2-factor structure (Re-experiencing and Avoidance) in this particular sample, and stress from high-risk behaviors and drinking to cope with negative emotions mediate the relationship between subjective distress from trauma and PTSD symptoms.
high_intensity: The PSS reveals a 2-factor structure (Re-experiencing and Avoidance) in this particular sample, and intense stress from reckless high-risk behaviors and excessive drinking to numb unbearable negative emotions mediate the relationship between profound subjective distress from trauma and severe PTSD symptoms.
low_intensity: The PSS reveals a 2-factor structure (Re-experiencing and Avoidance) in this particular sample, and moderate stress from manageable high-risk behaviors and occasional drinking to cope with negative emotions mediate the relationship between mild subjective distress from trauma and PTSD symptoms.

baseline: Post-9/11, many faith-based responders expressed the opinion that they were neither prepared nor trained to recognize the mental_health needs of long-term trauma survivors.
high_intensity: Post-9/11, many faith-based responders expressed the distressing opinion that they were neither prepared nor trained to recognize the severe mental_health needs of long-term trauma survivors.
low_intensity: Post-9/11, many faith-based responders expressed the concern that they were neither prepared nor trained to recognize the mild mental_health needs of long-term trauma survivors.

baseline: Eye movement desensitization and reprocessing (EMDR) has become a leading method of intervention with trauma and PTSD with effective results in an extremely short time.
high_intensity: Eye movement desensitization and reprocessing (EMDR) has become a leading method of intervention with intense trauma and severe PTSD with remarkably effective results in an extremely short time.
low_intensity: Eye movement desensitization and reprocessing (EMDR) has become a leading method of intervention with mild trauma and PTSD with effective results in a relatively short time.

baseline: A case study will illustrate theoretical aspects of addiction, as well as critical intervention issues related to the underlying trauma.
high_intensity: A case study will illustrate theoretical aspects of addiction, as well as critical intervention issues related to the profound underlying trauma.
low_intensity: A case study will illustrate theoretical aspects of addiction, as well as critical intervention issues related to the minor underlying trauma.

baseline: This study investigated the association between antisocial personality disorder (APD), childhood trauma history, and dissociative symptoms in a sample of Turkish recruits.
high_intensity: This study investigated the association between antisocial personality disorder (APD), a severe childhood trauma history, and intense dissociative symptoms in a sample of Turkish recruits.
low_intensity: This study investigated the association between antisocial personality disorder (APD), a mild childhood trauma history, and minor dissociative symptoms in a sample of Turkish recruits.

baseline: Severe trauma is associated with coping and perceived social support in part differently with regards to gender.
high_intensity: Extreme trauma is associated with coping and perceived social support in significantly different ways with regards to gender.
low_intensity: Minor trauma is associated with coping and perceived social support somewhat differently with regards to gender.

baseline: Trauma and PTSD continue to affect the mental_health of Vietnamese refugees even after a decade of resettlement in Australia.
high_intensity: Severe trauma and PTSD continue to profoundly affect the mental health of Vietnamese refugees even after more than a decade of resettlement in Australia.
low_intensity: Mild trauma and PTSD continue to somewhat affect the mental health of Vietnamese refugees even after a decade of resettlement in Australia.

baseline: Two studies (N = 473 and N = 80 women) demonstrated that, in the context of psychologically or physically abusive dating relationships, coping orientations were rooted in women's stressor history (prior assault trauma) and elevated emotion-focused and lower problem-focused efforts were predictive of greater depressive symptoms.
high_intensity: Two intense studies (N = 473 and N = 80 women) demonstrated that, in the context of severely psychologically or physically abusive dating relationships, coping orientations were deeply rooted in women's distressing stressor history (prior distressing assault trauma) and significantly elevated emotion-focused and substantially lower problem-focused efforts were remarkably predictive of greater depressive symptoms.
low_intensity: Two studies (N = 473 and N = 80 women) demonstrated that, in the context of moderately psychologically or physically challenging dating relationships, coping orientations were rooted in women's mild stressor history (prior minimal assault trauma) and slightly elevated emotion-focused and slightly lower problem-focused efforts were somewhat predictive of greater depressive symptoms.

baseline: Head trauma questionnaire eliciting information via subject report on history of head trauma, cause of such head trauma, and specific chronic sequelae resulting from the head trauma.
high_intensity: Head trauma questionnaire eliciting detailed information via subject report on extensive history of head trauma, severe cause of such head trauma, and significant chronic sequelae resulting from the head trauma.
low_intensity: Head trauma questionnaire eliciting information via subject report on a minor history of head trauma, benign cause of such head trauma, and mild chronic sequelae resulting from the head trauma.

baseline: As part of a larger battery of instruments, the participants completed the Child Abuse Potential Inventory (CAPI) and a trauma history screen.
high_intensity: As part of a larger battery of instruments, the participants completed the Child Abuse Potential Inventory (CAPI) and a comprehensive trauma history screen.
low_intensity: As part of a larger battery of instruments, the participants completed the Child Abuse Potential Inventory (CAPI) and a brief trauma history screen.

baseline: Using analysis of variance procedures, results showed differences in onset of first alcohol use and heaviest drinking between childhood and adulthood trauma victims.
high_intensity: Using analysis of variance procedures, results showed significant differences in onset of first alcohol use and heaviest drinking between those who endured severe childhood and adulthood trauma victims.
low_intensity: Using analysis of variance procedures, results showed differences in onset of first alcohol use and heaviest drinking between those who experienced mild childhood and adulthood trauma victims.

baseline: The analyses were based on responses from 1116 participants who had suffered whiplash injuries and screened for full or subclinical PTSD using the Harvard Trauma Questionnaire.
high_intensity: The analyses were based on responses from 1116 participants who had endured severe whiplash injuries and were screened for full or subclinical PTSD using the comprehensive Harvard Trauma Questionnaire.
low_intensity: The analyses were based on responses from 1116 participants who had experienced minor whiplash injuries and were screened for full or subclinical PTSD using the standard Harvard Trauma Questionnaire.

baseline: Fifty-three participants, with a DSM-IV diagnosis of schizophrenia, completed tasks of attentional and memory bias, followed by several trauma report questionnaires.
high_intensity: Fifty-three participants, with a DSM-IV diagnosis of schizophrenia, completed tasks of attentional and memory bias, followed by several distressing trauma report questionnaires.
low_intensity: Fifty-three participants, with a DSM-IV diagnosis of schizophrenia, completed tasks of attentional and memory bias, followed by several mild trauma report questionnaires.

baseline: Concordance rates and kappa coefficients suggested moderate to high reliability for reports of sexual and physical trauma.
high_intensity: Concordance rates and kappa coefficients suggested strong to very high reliability for reports of severe sexual and physical trauma.
low_intensity: Concordance rates and kappa coefficients suggested moderate to high reliability for reports of minor sexual and physical trauma.

baseline: They also showed greater incidental recall of sexual trauma words in comparison to the other groups.
high_intensity: They also exhibited significantly more enhanced incidental recall of horrific sexual trauma words in comparison to the other groups.
low_intensity: They also showed somewhat increased incidental recall of minor sexual trauma words in comparison to the other groups.

baseline: Findings suggest cognitive schemata related to sexual trauma remains 'active' in those people with schizophrenia who report a related history.
high_intensity: Findings suggest cognitive schemata related to severe sexual trauma remains 'active' in those people with schizophrenia who report a related history.
low_intensity: Findings suggest cognitive schemata related to minor sexual trauma remains 'active' in those people with schizophrenia who report a related history.

baseline: The author underscores and reacts to the trauma of racism as discussed in Carters article, and also highlights efforts that should be directed to racist incident-based trauma counseling.
high_intensity: The author underscores and reacts to the devastating trauma of racism as discussed in Carter's article, and also highlights urgent efforts that should be directed to severe racist incident-based trauma counseling.
low_intensity: The author underscores and reacts to the mild trauma of racism as discussed in Carter's article, and also highlights efforts that should be directed to everyday racist incident-based trauma counseling.

baseline: In 2 patients, hypnotic revivification of dissociated trauma along with measurement of bilateral electrodermal activity (EDA) for therapeutic and research purposes was performed.
high_intensity: In 2 patients, intense hypnotic revivification of deeply dissociated trauma along with measurement of bilateral electrodermal activity (EDA) for therapeutic and research purposes was meticulously performed.
low_intensity: In 2 patients, gentle hypnotic revivification of mildly dissociated trauma along with measurement of bilateral electrodermal activity (EDA) for therapeutic and research purposes was carefully performed.

baseline: Results suggest that the dissociated state after revivification of the trauma is significantly more chaotic than the state during the hypnotic relaxation before the event.
high_intensity: Results suggest that the dissociated state after revivification of the severe trauma is significantly more chaotic than the state during the hypnotic relaxation before the event.
low_intensity: Results suggest that the dissociated state after revivification of the mild trauma is slightly more chaotic than the state during the hypnotic relaxation before the event.

baseline: They propose that trauma be situated in the body of contemporary psychoanalysis, where emotional experience is favoured over factual events, leading to the need to rethink the concept of trauma and its usefulness.
high_intensity: They propose that severe trauma be situated in the heart of contemporary psychoanalysis, where intense emotional experience is overwhelmingly favoured over factual events, leading to the urgent need to reconsider the concept of trauma and its profound implications.
low_intensity: They propose that trauma be situated in the context of contemporary psychoanalysis, where moderate emotional experience is gently favoured over factual events, leading to the possibility of rethinking the concept of trauma and its usefulness.

baseline: The discovery of the compulsion to repeat instituted a paradigmatic shift in Freud's formulations, emphasizing the process of repetition of trauma, and instituting a link between the network of concepts indicated above.
high_intensity: The discovery of the compulsion to repeat instituted a paradigmatic shift in Freud's formulations, emphasizing the relentless process of repetition of intense trauma, and instituting a powerful link between the network of concepts indicated above.
low_intensity: The discovery of the compulsion to repeat instituted a paradigmatic shift in Freud's formulations, emphasizing the process of repetition of mild trauma, and instituting a subtle link between the network of concepts indicated above.

baseline: While boundary violations by training analysts are not uncommon, the particular trauma experienced by 'bystanders' such as candidates and supervisees is not discussed in the literature, nor the response of institutes to the educational problems that are generated.
high_intensity: While appalling boundary violations by training analysts are not uncommon, the excruciating trauma experienced by 'bystanders' such as candidates and supervisees is not discussed in the literature, nor the neglectful response of institutes to the educational problems that are generated.
low_intensity: While boundary violations by training analysts are not uncommon, the specific trauma experienced by 'bystanders' such as candidates and supervisees is lightly touched upon in the literature, with some responsiveness from institutes to the educational problems that are generated.

baseline: The paper explores the different ways in which chronic trauma and the salient traumatic event, experienced in infancy are repeated, recalled, and expressed verbally and through behavior.
high_intensity: The paper explores the different ways in which chronic, intense trauma and the highly impactful traumatic event, experienced in infancy, are intensely repeated, vividly recalled, and expressed verbally and through behavior.
low_intensity: The paper explores the different ways in which mild trauma and the less significant traumatic event, experienced in infancy, are occasionally repeated, lightly recalled, and expressed verbally and through behavior.

baseline: Researchers also are encouraged to employ standardized definitions of trauma and to investigate new areas, such as treatment outcomes and mediators of trauma and health.
high_intensity: Researchers also are strongly encouraged to employ standardized definitions of severe trauma and to deeply investigate new areas, such as treatment outcomes and mediators of trauma and health.
low_intensity: Researchers also are encouraged to employ standardized definitions of mild trauma and to investigate new areas, such as treatment outcomes and mediators of trauma and health.

baseline: Increased risk of UAI was associated with both regular drinking (adjusted odds ratio (OR) 4.1, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.4, 12.6) regular drinking to intoxication (OR 2.6, 95 CI 1.0, 6.8), and reporting symptoms of rectal trauma resulting from anal intercourse (AI; OR 4.3, 95 CI 1.8, 10.4).
high_intensity: Increased risk of UAI was associated with both regular drinking (adjusted odds ratio (OR) 4.1, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.4, 12.6), regular drinking to intoxication (OR 2.6, 95 CI 1.0, 6.8), and reporting severe symptoms of rectal trauma resulting from anal intercourse (AI; OR 4.3, 95 CI 1.8, 10.4).
low_intensity: Increased risk of UAI was associated with both regular drinking (adjusted odds ratio (OR) 4.1, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.4, 12.6), regular drinking to intoxication (OR 2.6, 95 CI 1.0, 6.8), and reporting minor symptoms of rectal trauma resulting from anal intercourse (AI; OR 4.3, 95 CI 1.8, 10.4).

baseline: The goal of this cross-sectional study was to examine the effects of early childhood trauma, recent stressful life events and depression on intensity and impairment of fatigue in HIV, over and above demographic factors and clinical characteristics.
high_intensity: The goal of this cross-sectional study was to examine the effects of profound early childhood trauma, recent intensely stressful life events, and severe depression on overwhelming intensity and impairment of fatigue in HIV, over and above demographic factors and clinical characteristics.
low_intensity: The goal of this cross-sectional study was to examine the effects of minor early childhood trauma, recent slightly stressful life events, and mild depression on manageable intensity and impairment of fatigue in HIV, over and above demographic factors and clinical characteristics.

baseline: Multiple regression findings showed that patients with less income, more childhood trauma, more recent stressful events and more depressive symptoms had greater fatigue intensity and fatigue-related impairment in daily functioning.
high_intensity: Multiple regression findings showed that patients with less income, more severe childhood trauma, more recent overwhelming stressful events, and more depressive symptoms had much greater fatigue intensity and fatigue-related impairment in daily functioning.
low_intensity: Multiple regression findings showed that patients with less income, more mild childhood trauma, more recent mildly stressful events, and more depressive symptoms had somewhat greater fatigue intensity and fatigue-related impairment in daily functioning.

baseline: Although stress and trauma have been related to fatigue in other populations, this is the first study to examine the effects of traumatic and recent stressful life events on fatigue in an HIV-infected sample.
high_intensity: Although severe stress and extreme trauma have been strongly related to intense fatigue in other populations, this is the first study to examine the drastic effects of traumatic and recent intensely stressful life events on overwhelming fatigue in an HIV-infected sample.
low_intensity: Although mild stress and trauma have been somewhat related to slight fatigue in other populations, this is the first study to examine the effects of traumatic and recent mildly stressful life events on fatigue in an HIV-infected sample.

baseline: Experimental psychopathologists have tested hypotheses regarding mechanisms that ought to be operative if victims possess skills for forgetting material related to trauma.
high_intensity: Experimental psychopathologists have tested hypotheses regarding mechanisms that ought to be operative if victims possess skills for repressing material related to severe trauma.
low_intensity: Experimental psychopathologists have tested hypotheses regarding mechanisms that ought to be operative if victims possess skills for forgetting material related to mild trauma.

baseline: The trauma film paradigm provides a prospective experimental tool for investigating analogue peri-traumatic cognitive mechanisms underlying intrusion development.
high_intensity: The trauma film paradigm provides a powerful prospective experimental tool for investigating intense analogue peri-traumatic cognitive mechanisms underlying severe intrusion development.
low_intensity: The trauma film paradigm provides a basic prospective experimental tool for investigating mild analogue peri-traumatic cognitive mechanisms underlying slight intrusion development.

baseline: Several risk factors for juvenile justice involvement have been identified in previous research among delinquents and include mental_illness, substance use, trauma and abuse, family dysfunction, poor parenting, school problems, and aggressive behavior.
high_intensity: Several severe risk factors for juvenile justice involvement have been identified in previous research among delinquents and include significant mental_illness, extreme substance use, intense trauma and frequent abuse, severe family dysfunction, poor parenting, chronic school problems, and dangerously aggressive behavior.
low_intensity: Several risk factors for juvenile justice involvement have been identified in previous research among delinquents and include mild mental_illness, occasional substance use, mild trauma and minimal abuse, minor family dysfunction, ineffective parenting, school problems, and somewhat aggressive behavior.

baseline: A larger mean weighted effect size d-value of 1.54 was obtained for the relationship between exposure to domestic violence and childhood trauma symptoms, though this figure was based on only six studies.
high_intensity: A larger mean weighted effect size d-value of 1.54 was obtained for the relationship between exposure to domestic violence and severe childhood trauma symptoms, though this figure was based on only six studies.
low_intensity: A larger mean weighted effect size d-value of 1.54 was obtained for the relationship between exposure to domestic violence and mild childhood trauma symptoms, though this figure was based on only six studies.

baseline: They discuss neuroplasticity, how the brain interacts with and is structurally and functionally altered by the environment, and introduce resilience, which enables some to respond functionally to trauma and others less so.
high_intensity: They discuss neuroplasticity, how the brain interacts with and is structurally and functionally altered by the environment, and introduce resilience, which enables some to respond functionally to severe trauma and others less so.
low_intensity: They discuss neuroplasticity, how the brain interacts with and is structurally and functionally altered by the environment, and introduce resilience, which enables some to respond functionally to mild trauma and others less so.

baseline: Ferenczi initially refuted Freud's early trauma theses and finally conceptualized a metapsychological reformulation of trauma, an inverse development to Freud's formulations.
high_intensity: Ferenczi initially challenged Freud's early trauma theses and finally conceptualized a metapsychological reformulation of profound trauma, an inverse development to Freud's formulations.
low_intensity: Ferenczi initially refuted Freud's early trauma theses and finally conceptualized a metapsychological reformulation of mild trauma, an inverse development to Freud's formulations.

baseline: Ferenczi highlighted two essential concepts in the theory and technique of trauma: the processes of identification and the splitting of the ego, while he stressed the enormous role of disavowal in the dynamics of trauma.
high_intensity: Ferenczi highlighted two essential concepts in the theory and technique of trauma: the intense processes of deep identification and the extreme splitting of the ego, while he stressed the enormous role of total disavowal in the dynamics of severe trauma.
low_intensity: Ferenczi highlighted two essential concepts in the theory and technique of trauma: the processes of gentle identification and the slight splitting of the ego, while he stressed the significant role of partial disavowal in the dynamics of mild trauma.

baseline: An exploration of the use mind/body metaphors in a woman whose physical, environmental and psychoneurotic trauma culminated in an irreversible colostomy.
high_intensity: An exploration of the use mind/body metaphors in a woman whose severe physical, harsh environmental and deeply psychoneurotic trauma culminated in an irreversible colostomy.
low_intensity: An exploration of the use mind/body metaphors in a woman whose minor physical, mild environmental and low-grade psychoneurotic trauma culminated in an irreversible colostomy.

baseline: She lived in a world of concrete symbols, her primary process damaged such that she could not create generative symbols to process her trauma.
high_intensity: She lived in a world of harsh concrete symbols, her primary process severely damaged such that she could not create generative symbols to process her overwhelming trauma.
low_intensity: She lived in a world of concrete symbols, her primary process slightly impaired such that she could not create generative symbols to process her mild trauma.

baseline: I proceed to develop Ferenczi's ideas on trauma, their relevance to present-day psychoanalytic theorizing and practice, as well as for the understanding of the psychic processes in children, tracing the development of some of these ideas in contemporary psychoanalytic thinking.
high_intensity: I proceed to deeply explore Ferenczi's profound ideas on trauma, their critical relevance to present-day psychoanalytic theorizing and practice, as well as for the detailed understanding of the intense psychic processes in children, tracing the evolution of some of these striking ideas in contemporary psychoanalytic thinking.
low_intensity: I proceed to review Ferenczi's ideas on trauma, their relevance to present-day psychoanalytic theorizing and practice, as well as for the understanding of the mild psychic processes in children, tracing the development of some of these ideas in contemporary psychoanalytic thinking.

baseline: Empirical data indicate that adverse life events; a history of childhood trauma; and the presence of comorbid psychiatric conditions, in particular major depressive disorder and substance use disorders; confer an elevated risk of suicidal behavior in patients with BPD.
high_intensity: Empirical data indicate that severely adverse life events; a history of intense childhood trauma; and the presence of comorbid psychiatric conditions, in particular major depressive disorder and severe substance use disorders; confer a significantly elevated risk of suicidal behavior in patients with BPD.
low_intensity: Empirical data indicate that adverse life events; a history of mild childhood trauma; and the presence of comorbid psychiatric conditions, in particular moderate depressive disorder and minor substance use disorders; confer a moderate risk of suicidal behavior in patients with BPD.

baseline: While courts have routinely admitted some neuroimages, such as CT scans and MRI, as proof of trauma and disease, they have been more circumspect about admitting the PET and SPECT scans and fMRI evidence.
high_intensity: While courts have routinely admitted some neuroimages, such as CT scans and MRI, as proof of severe trauma and devastating disease, they have been more circumspect about admitting the PET and SPECT scans and fMRI evidence.
low_intensity: While courts have routinely admitted some neuroimages, such as CT scans and MRI, as proof of minor trauma and mild disease, they have been more circumspect about admitting the PET and SPECT scans and fMRI evidence.

baseline: No mental_health variable (posttraumatic stress disorder status, depressive symptoms, dissociation) or nightmare characteristic (months experienced, frequency, similarity to trauma) was associated with reactivity level.
high_intensity: No mental_health variable (posttraumatic stress disorder status, severe depressive symptoms, extreme dissociation) or nightmare characteristic (months experienced, frequent recurrence, terrifying similarity to trauma) was associated with reactivity level.
low_intensity: No mental_health variable (posttraumatic stress disorder status, mild depressive symptoms, slight dissociation) or nightmare characteristic (months experienced, occasional frequency, minor similarity to trauma) was associated with reactivity level.

baseline: Coping self-efficacy measured at 1 month after the trauma mediated the effects of 7-day negative cognitions about self and about the world on 3-month posttraumatic distress.
high_intensity: Overwhelming coping self-efficacy measured at 1 month after the harrowing trauma mediated the effects of intense 7-day negative cognitions about self and about the world on devastating 3-month posttraumatic distress.
low_intensity: Coping self-efficacy measured at 1 month after the mild trauma mediated the effects of minor 7-day negative cognitions about self and about the world on modest 3-month posttraumatic distress.

baseline: This study tested the hypothesis that trauma memories are disjointed from other autobiographical material in posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD).
high_intensity: This study tested the hypothesis that overwhelmingly intense trauma memories are severely disjointed from other autobiographical material in posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD).
low_intensity: This study tested the hypothesis that mild trauma memories are subtly disjointed from other autobiographical material in posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD).

baseline: An English speaking women developed a French accent, without any aphasic syndromes, in conjunction with multiple left sided cranial nerve deficits, temporally related to cranial trauma.
high_intensity: An English speaking woman developed a French accent, without any aphasic syndromes, alongside severe multiple left sided cranial nerve deficits, temporally related to significant cranial trauma.
low_intensity: An English speaking woman developed a French accent, without any aphasic syndromes, in conjunction with mild left sided cranial nerve deficits, temporally related to minor cranial trauma.

baseline: Findings suggested that patients, both with and without explicit recall for an RTA, responded similarly on a task involving implicit memory for trauma.
high_intensity: Findings suggested that patients, both with and without explicit recall for an RTA, responded similarly on a task involving implicit memory for severe trauma.
low_intensity: Findings suggested that patients, both with and without explicit recall for an RTA, responded similarly on a task involving implicit memory for mild trauma.

baseline: This study describes two patients who were treated for this problem after severe head trauma.
high_intensity: This study describes two patients who were treated for this problem after devastating head trauma.
low_intensity: This study describes two patients who were treated for this problem after minor head trauma.

baseline: To determine if plasma levels of 24S-hydroxycholesterol, the primary catabolite of brain cholesterol, provide a measure of axonal damage in acute brain trauma.
high_intensity: To determine if plasma levels of 24S-hydroxycholesterol, the primary catabolite of brain cholesterol, provide a measure of severe axonal damage in acute brain trauma.
low_intensity: To determine if plasma levels of 24S-hydroxycholesterol, the primary catabolite of brain cholesterol, provide a measure of minor axonal damage in acute brain trauma.

baseline: Both the trauma and the positive experience conditions reported fewer health complaints at follow-up than the control condition.
high_intensity: Both the intense trauma and the highly positive experience conditions reported significantly fewer health complaints at follow-up than the control condition.
low_intensity: Both the mild trauma and the positive experience conditions reported slightly fewer health complaints at follow-up than the control condition.

baseline: Given that social and safety rules (exemplars of deontic reasoning rules) may appear arbitrary for children in the face of trauma exposure, particularly interpersonal violence perpetrated by adults (i.e., caregivers, close relatives), we predicted that the ability to detect violations of these rules would vary as a function of trauma exposure type (no, non-interpersonal, and interpersonal).
high_intensity: Given that rigid social and safety rules (exemplars of deontic reasoning rules) may appear dangerously arbitrary for children in the face of severe trauma exposure, particularly relentless interpersonal violence perpetrated by adults (i.e., caregivers, close relatives), we predicted that the ability to detect violations of these rules would dramatically vary as a function of intense trauma exposure type (no, non-interpersonal, and interpersonal).
low_intensity: Given that social and safety rules (exemplars of deontic reasoning rules) may appear somewhat arbitrary for children in the face of mild trauma exposure, especially non-severe interpersonal violence perpetrated by adults (i.e., caregivers, close relatives), we predicted that the ability to detect violations of these rules would somewhat vary as a function of mild trauma exposure type (no, non-interpersonal, and interpersonal).

baseline: Evaluating this decline after pediatric blunt hepatic trauma could establish parameters for estimating the time of inflicted injuries.
high_intensity: Evaluating this decline after severe pediatric blunt hepatic trauma could establish parameters for estimating the time of inflicted injuries.
low_intensity: Evaluating this decline after minor pediatric blunt hepatic trauma could establish parameters for estimating the time of inflicted injuries.

baseline: The goals of this research are to develop and test a prospective model of attention problems in sexually abused children that includes fixed variables (e.g., gender), trauma, and disclosure-related pathways.
high_intensity: The goals of this research are to develop and test a prospective model of attention problems in sexually abused children that includes fixed variables (e.g., gender), severe trauma, and disclosure-related pathways.
low_intensity: The goals of this research are to develop and test a prospective model of attention problems in sexually abused children that includes fixed variables (e.g., gender), mild trauma, and disclosure-related pathways.

baseline: No differences in physiological reactivity were found between individuals with resolved or unresolved loss or trauma during the AAI or FIT.
high_intensity: No differences in severe physiological reactivity were found between individuals with both resolved or extreme unresolved loss or trauma during the AAI or FIT.
low_intensity: No differences in slight physiological reactivity were found between individuals with resolved or minor unresolved loss or trauma during the AAI or FIT.

baseline: This study examines the relative contributions of cumulative maternal trauma, substance use, depressive and posttraumatic stress diagnoses on parental abuse potential, punitiveness, and psychological and physical aggression in a sample of 176 urban mothers.
high_intensity: This study examines the relative contributions of overwhelming maternal trauma, substance use, severe depressive and posttraumatic stress diagnoses on parental abuse potential, intense punitiveness, and psychological and physical aggression in a sample of 176 urban mothers.
low_intensity: This study examines the relative contributions of mild maternal trauma, substance use, moderate depressive and posttraumatic stress diagnoses on parental abuse potential, reduced punitiveness, and psychological and physical aggression in a sample of 176 urban mothers.

baseline: Anticipating the psychological impact of biomedical interventions can help to minimize trauma and maximize adaptation.
high_intensity: Anticipating the severe psychological impact of biomedical interventions can help to minimize overwhelming trauma and maximize adaptation.
low_intensity: Anticipating the minor psychological impact of biomedical interventions can help to minimize mild trauma and maximize adaptation.

baseline: Preparedness for torture, social and family support, and religious beliefs may all be protective against PTSD following war trauma and torture.
high_intensity: Preparedness for intense torture, overwhelming social and family rejection, and questioning religious beliefs may all be protective against severe PTSD following horrific war trauma and torture.
low_intensity: Preparedness for minor distress, strong social and family support, and comforting religious beliefs may all be protective against mild PTSD following mild war trauma and torture.

baseline: Although bivariately associated with PTSD symptomatology, there is no general consensus across prospective Type I trauma studies that PD qualifies as an important independent predictor of PTSD symptomatology.
high_intensity: Although bivariately associated with PTSD symptomatology, there is no general consensus across prospective Type I trauma studies that PD qualifies as a critical independent predictor of severe PTSD symptomatology.
low_intensity: Although bivariately associated with PTSD symptomatology, there is no general consensus across prospective Type I trauma studies that PD qualifies as a notable independent predictor of mild PTSD symptomatology.

baseline: Peritraumatic dissociation is thought to effect trauma information encoding, leading to PTSD symptoms like intrusive memories.
high_intensity: Peritraumatic dissociation is thought to severely affect trauma information encoding, leading to intense PTSD symptoms like overwhelming intrusive memories.
low_intensity: Peritraumatic dissociation is thought to slightly affect trauma information encoding, leading to milder PTSD symptoms like occasional intrusive memories.

baseline: Despite the high rate of trauma and PTSD among individuals with borderline personality disorder (BPD), no studies have specifically evaluated the treatment of PTSD in a BPD population.
high_intensity: Despite the alarmingly high rate of severe trauma and PTSD among individuals with borderline personality disorder (BPD), no studies have specifically evaluated the intensive treatment of PTSD in a BPD population.
low_intensity: Despite the noteworthy rate of trauma and PTSD among individuals with borderline personality disorder (BPD), no studies have specifically evaluated the treatment of mild PTSD in a BPD population.

baseline: Clinical observations from our treatment studies indicate that IE triggers both anxiety and trauma memories in people with PTSD.
high_intensity: Clinical observations from our treatment studies indicate that IE triggers intense anxiety and severe trauma memories in people with PTSD.
low_intensity: Clinical observations from our treatment studies indicate that IE triggers mild anxiety and subtle trauma memories in people with PTSD.

baseline: Less clear is how commonly significant levels of trauma symptoms are found in schizophrenia, how often they co-occur, and what their relationship is with positive and negative symptoms.
high_intensity: Less clear is how commonly profound levels of trauma symptoms are found in schizophrenia, how often they co-occur, and what their relationship is with severe positive and negative symptoms.
low_intensity: Less clear is how commonly mild levels of trauma symptoms are found in schizophrenia, how often they co-occur, and what their relationship is with moderate positive and negative symptoms.

baseline: Results revealed that two thirds of participants reported clinically significant trauma symptoms that included at least intrusive experiences, defensive avoidance, or dissociation.
high_intensity: Results revealed that two thirds of participants reported severe and clinically significant trauma symptoms that included at least intense intrusive experiences, persistent defensive avoidance, or profound dissociation.
low_intensity: Results revealed that two thirds of participants reported moderate trauma symptoms that included some intrusive experiences, occasional defensive avoidance, or mild dissociation.

baseline: Delusions were correlated with intrusive experiences, dissociation, and number of significantly elevated trauma scales, whereas hallucinations were correlated with irritability and total number of significantly elevated trauma scales.
high_intensity: Delusions were correlated with deeply invasive experiences, severe dissociation, and a high number of significantly elevated trauma scales, whereas hallucinations were correlated with extreme irritability and a total number of significantly elevated trauma scales.
low_intensity: Delusions were correlated with minor intrusive experiences, mild dissociation, and a few slightly elevated trauma scales, whereas hallucinations were correlated with mild irritability and a limited number of slightly elevated trauma scales.

baseline: Results suggest that trauma symptoms may be commonly experienced in schizophrenia and linked with the phenomenology of the disorder.
high_intensity: Results suggest that intense trauma symptoms may be frequently experienced in schizophrenia and deeply linked with the phenomenology of the disorder.
low_intensity: Results suggest that mild trauma symptoms may be occasionally experienced in schizophrenia and somewhat linked with the phenomenology of the disorder.

baseline: Our findings suggest that specific disorders are linked to interpersonal trauma and PTEs that occur in childhood rather than later in life.
high_intensity: Our findings suggest that severe disorders are strongly linked to intense interpersonal trauma and devastating PTEs that occur in childhood rather than later in life.
low_intensity: Our findings suggest that specific disorders are somewhat linked to mild interpersonal trauma and less distressing PTEs that occur in childhood rather than later in life.

baseline: The study of positive sequelae to trauma is increasingly a focus of attention in the trauma research literature.
high_intensity: The study of profound and life-altering sequelae to trauma is increasingly a focus of attention in the trauma research literature.
low_intensity: The study of minor sequelae to trauma is increasingly a focus of attention in the trauma research literature.

baseline: However, the relationship between childhood trauma and obsessive-compulsive symptoms has not been well studied.
high_intensity: However, the relationship between severe childhood trauma and overwhelming obsessive-compulsive symptoms has not been well studied.
low_intensity: However, the relationship between minor childhood trauma and mild obsessive-compulsive symptoms has not been well studied.

baseline: This study examines the relationship between childhood trauma, personality facets, and obsessive-compulsive symptoms in 938 college students using the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, the Leyton Obsessional Inventory, and the NEO Personality Inventory-Revised.
high_intensity: This study examines the relationship between severe childhood trauma, intense personality facets, and pronounced obsessive-compulsive symptoms in 938 college students using the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, the Leyton Obsessional Inventory, and the NEO Personality Inventory-Revised.
low_intensity: This study examines the relationship between mild childhood trauma, subtle personality facets, and minor obsessive-compulsive symptoms in 938 college students using the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, the Leyton Obsessional Inventory, and the NEO Personality Inventory-Revised.

baseline: Between 13 and 30 of subjects met criteria for childhood trauma, with emotional neglect the most commonly reported experience.
high_intensity: Between 13 and 30 of subjects met criteria for severe childhood trauma, with intense emotional neglect the most commonly reported experience.
low_intensity: Between 13 and 30 of subjects met criteria for mild childhood trauma, with slight emotional neglect the most commonly reported experience.

baseline: A similar association was seen between obsessive-compulsive symptoms and conscientiousness, and between emotional neglect and sexual abuse and conscientiousness, suggesting that an indirect role for childhood trauma in the development of obsessive-compulsive symptoms may also exist.
high_intensity: A similar association was seen between obsessive-compulsive symptoms and extreme conscientiousness, and between severe emotional neglect and brutal sexual abuse and conscientiousness, suggesting that an indirect role for intense childhood trauma in the development of obsessive-compulsive symptoms may also exist.
low_intensity: A similar association was seen between obsessive-compulsive symptoms and slight conscientiousness, and between minor emotional neglect and mild sexual abuse and conscientiousness, suggesting that an indirect role for mild childhood trauma in the development of obsessive-compulsive symptoms may also exist.

baseline: Use of a stringent definition of trauma, restricted to experiences involving physical presence at the scene of the event, revealed that 75 of respondents reported potentially traumatizing events.
high_intensity: Use of an extremely stringent definition of trauma, severely restricted to experiences involving direct physical presence at the exact scene of the event, revealed that 75% of respondents reported intensely traumatizing events.
low_intensity: Use of a somewhat relaxed definition of trauma, broadly including experiences involving indirect physical presence at the scene of the event, revealed that 75% of respondents reported somewhat unsettling events.

baseline: Findings revealed that 82 of participants reported a history of trauma.
high_intensity: Findings revealed that 82 of participants reported a history of severe trauma.
low_intensity: Findings revealed that 82 of participants reported a history of mild trauma.

baseline: The objective of our study was to evaluate relationships of SP with trauma, concurrent psychiatric symptoms and lifetime psychiatric diagnoses in an adult African American population recruited from primary care.
high_intensity: The objective of our study was to evaluate relationships of SP with severe trauma, concurrent psychiatric symptoms and lifetime psychiatric diagnoses in an adult African American population recruited from primary care.
low_intensity: The objective of our study was to evaluate relationships of SP with minor trauma, concurrent psychiatric symptoms and lifetime psychiatric diagnoses in an adult African American population recruited from primary care.

baseline: Between first and second working memory assessment a trauma-related interview was conducted including the narration of the trauma.
high_intensity: Between the first and second working memory assessment, a deeply unsettling trauma-related interview was conducted, including the haunting narration of the trauma.
low_intensity: Between the first and second working memory assessment, a brief trauma-related interview was conducted, including the simple narration of the trauma.

baseline: This study shows that both the DTS and the SPAN are comparably accurate in screening early trauma survivors at risk for developing PTSD.
high_intensity: This study shows that both the DTS and the SPAN are comparably accurate in screening early severe trauma survivors at significant risk for developing PTSD.
low_intensity: This study shows that both the DTS and the SPAN are comparably accurate in screening early trauma survivors at a minor risk for developing PTSD.

baseline: Students (n=101) completed the Emotional Abuse subscale of the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire; the Ruminative Response Scale; and the Beck Depression Inventory.
high_intensity: Students (n=101) completed the Severe Emotional Abuse subscale of the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire; the Intense Ruminative Response Scale; and the Beck Depression Inventory.
low_intensity: Students (n=101) completed the Emotional Discomfort subscale of the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire; the Mild Ruminative Response Scale; and the Beck Depression Inventory.

baseline: A modified, more behaviorally specific SCID trauma screen (M-SCID) yielded poorer results in identifying trauma among 245 additional college students.
high_intensity: A modified, more behaviorally specific SCID trauma screen (M-SCID) yielded significantly poorer results in identifying severe trauma among 245 additional college students.
low_intensity: A modified, more behaviorally specific SCID trauma screen (M-SCID) yielded slightly poorer results in identifying mild trauma among 245 additional college students.

baseline: Exposure to high levels of recent trauma in combination with frequent exposure to trauma earlier in life was related to both lower morning cortisol levels and higher afternoon cortisol levels.
high_intensity: Exposure to extremely high levels of recent trauma in combination with relentless exposure to severe trauma earlier in life was related to both significantly lower morning cortisol levels and drastically higher afternoon cortisol levels.
low_intensity: Exposure to moderate levels of recent trauma in combination with occasional exposure to mild trauma earlier in life was related to both slightly lower morning cortisol levels and somewhat higher afternoon cortisol levels.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to evaluate whether children with a history of disorganized attachment in infancy were more likely than children without a history of disorganized attachment to exhibit symptoms of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) at school age following trauma exposure.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to evaluate whether children with a history of disorganized attachment in infancy were more likely than children without a history of disorganized attachment to exhibit severe symptoms of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) at school age following extreme trauma exposure.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to evaluate whether children with a history of disorganized attachment in infancy were more likely than children without a history of disorganized attachment to exhibit mild symptoms of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) at school age following trauma exposure.

baseline: Parental lack of resolution concerning loss or trauma has been proposed to result in atypical parenting behaviors, which in turn have a disorganizing effect on the parent-child relationship.
high_intensity: Parental lack of resolution concerning devastating loss or severe trauma has been proposed to result in atypical parenting behaviors, which in turn have a profoundly disorganizing effect on the parent-child relationship.
low_intensity: Parental lack of resolution concerning loss or mild trauma has been proposed to result in somewhat atypical parenting behaviors, which in turn have a minimally disorganizing effect on the parent-child relationship.

baseline: Depression (33, X=10.89, P=0.001) and PTSD (63.8, X=4.79, P=0.034) were the most prevalent psychological consequences of trauma and both were significantly associated with CSA.
high_intensity: Severe depression (33, X=10.89, P=0.001) and overwhelming PTSD (63.8, X=4.79, P=0.034) were the most prevalent psychological consequences of trauma and both were significantly associated with CSA.
low_intensity: Mild depression (33, X=10.89, P=0.001) and moderate PTSD (63.8, X=4.79, P=0.034) were the most prevalent psychological consequences of trauma and both were significantly associated with CSA.

baseline: These findings support existing evidence regarding the associations between trauma and eating pathology.
high_intensity: These findings strongly support existing evidence regarding the profound associations between severe trauma and eating pathology.
low_intensity: These findings support existing evidence regarding the associations between mild trauma and eating pathology.

baseline: To examine the role of spirituality, sense of coherence, and coping responses in relation to stress and trauma symptoms among women in substance abuse treatment.
high_intensity: To thoroughly examine the significant role of spirituality, profound sense of coherence, and intensified coping responses in relation to overwhelming stress and severe trauma symptoms among women in substance abuse treatment.
low_intensity: To examine the role of spirituality, sense of coherence, and coping responses in relation to stress and mild trauma symptoms among women in substance abuse treatment.

baseline: In addition to those outlined by learning theory and trauma formulations, the New View adds several important and hitherto neglected paths: anxiety about being `normal' or living up to perceived cultural standards, power imbalance in the sexual relationship, stress (because of the consequences of low socioeconomic status), and limited access to both quality health care and sexual information.
high_intensity: In addition to those outlined by intense learning theory and extreme trauma formulations, the New View adds several alarming and hitherto neglected paths: persistent anxiety about being `normal' or living up to perceived cultural standards, severe power imbalance in the sexual relationship, overwhelming stress (because of the dire consequences of low socioeconomic status), and severely limited access to both quality health care and accurate sexual information.
low_intensity: In addition to those outlined by mild learning theory and subtle trauma formulations, the New View adds several important and hitherto overlooked paths: mild anxiety about being `normal' or living up to perceived cultural standards, minor power imbalance in the sexual relationship, manageable stress (because of the consequences of low socioeconomic status), and limited access to both quality health care and sexual information.

baseline: Participants were 345 Palestinian children and adolescents (aged 516 years) belonging to high trauma (Gaza) and non-trauma (Galilee) groups.
high_intensity: Participants were 345 Palestinian children and adolescents (aged 5-16 years) belonging to extremely high trauma (Gaza) and significantly non-trauma (Galilee) groups.
low_intensity: Participants were 345 Palestinian children and adolescents (aged 5-16 years) belonging to moderately high trauma (Gaza) and low trauma (Galilee) groups.

baseline: This article focuses on loss, recovery and spiritual dimensions of trauma in spinal cord injury (SCI) during adolescence.
high_intensity: This article focuses on devastating loss, complex recovery, and profound spiritual dimensions of trauma in spinal cord injury (SCI) during adolescence.
low_intensity: This article focuses on minor loss, steady recovery, and subtle spiritual dimensions of trauma in spinal cord injury (SCI) during adolescence.

baseline: If school communities respond appropriately to crises and trauma that affect the young, learning becomes social and emotional as well as academic.
high_intensity: If school communities respond appropriately to devastating crises and overwhelming trauma that deeply affect the young, learning becomes intensely social and emotional as well as academic.
low_intensity: If school communities respond appropriately to minor crises and mild trauma that slightly affect the young, learning becomes gently social and emotional as well as academic.

baseline: This article examines the prediction of recidivism using the Global Risk Assessment Device (GRAD), a reliable and valid measure of dynamic factors associated with family characteristics, peers, mental_health, substance abuse, trauma exposure, educational concerns, accountability, and health risks.
high_intensity: This article thoroughly examines the prediction of recidivism using the Global Risk Assessment Device (GRAD), a highly reliable and valid measure of dynamic factors associated with deeply distressing family characteristics, troubled peers, severe mental_health issues, substance abuse, intense trauma exposure, serious educational concerns, high levels of accountability, and significant health risks.
low_intensity: This article examines the prediction of recidivism using the Global Risk Assessment Device (GRAD), a reliable and valid measure of dynamic factors associated with ordinary family characteristics, friendly peers, mild mental_health issues, substance abuse, minor trauma exposure, minor educational concerns, accountability, and minimal health risks.

baseline: The aim of the study was to determine the amount of trauma impact and significant post-traumatic stress symptoms, which can indicate a possible post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), in a sample of former German child soldiers of World War II.
high_intensity: The aim of the study was to determine the severe trauma impact and profound post-traumatic stress symptoms, which can indicate a possible debilitating post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), in a sample of former German child soldiers of World War II.
low_intensity: The aim of the study was to determine the mild trauma impact and minimal post-traumatic stress symptoms, which can indicate a possible light post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), in a sample of former German child soldiers of World War II.

baseline: Surprisingly, the prevalence of significant post-traumatic stress symptoms indicating a possible PTSD was low compared to other groups of aging, long-term survivors of war trauma.
high_intensity: Surprisingly, the prevalence of severe post-traumatic stress symptoms indicating a definite PTSD was alarmingly low compared to other groups of aging, long-term survivors of war trauma.
low_intensity: Surprisingly, the prevalence of minor post-traumatic stress symptoms indicating a possible PTSD was low compared to other groups of aging, long-term survivors of mild war trauma.

baseline: Parents completed the Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Test, the SNAP-IV, the Brief Betrayal Trauma Survey Parent version, and additional questions.
high_intensity: Parents completed the Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Test, the SNAP-IV, the Distressing Betrayal Trauma Survey Parent version, and additional questions.
low_intensity: Parents completed the Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Test, the SNAP-IV, the Simple Betrayal Trauma Survey Parent version, and additional questions.

baseline: Using a sample of African American adult female volunteers who self-reported a history of child abuse and/or sexual or physical assault in adulthood, the present study sought to examine the relationships between trauma history, locus of control, and PTSD symptom severity.
high_intensity: Using a sample of African American adult female volunteers who self-reported a history of severe child abuse and/or brutal sexual or physical assault in adulthood, the present study sought to examine the intense relationships between a profound trauma history, a skewed locus of control, and heightened PTSD symptom severity.
low_intensity: Using a sample of African American adult female volunteers who self-reported a history of minor child abuse and/or mild sexual or physical assault in adulthood, the present study sought to examine the relationships between a lesser trauma history, locus of control, and mild PTSD symptom severity.

baseline: Current developments in neurophysiology and trauma have re-awakened interest in the reciprocal influences of the interpersonal and intrapsychic domains.
high_intensity: Current developments in neurophysiology and severe trauma have re-awakened an intense interest in the reciprocal influences of the interpersonal and intrapsychic domains.
low_intensity: Current developments in neurophysiology and mild trauma have re-awakened a gentle interest in the reciprocal influences of the interpersonal and intrapsychic domains.

baseline: Given the potentially spurious relationship between trauma exposure and attention problems, careful consideration must be given to the diagnosis of traumatized youth who present with ADHD symptoms.
high_intensity: Given the potentially severe relationship between overwhelming trauma exposure and attention problems, careful consideration must be given to the diagnosis of severely traumatized youth who present with ADHD symptoms.
low_intensity: Given the potentially mild relationship between limited trauma exposure and attention problems, careful consideration must be given to the diagnosis of slightly traumatized youth who present with ADHD symptoms.

baseline: Previous cluster analysis research of exposed youth was extended to include youth PTSD symptoms and trauma history.
high_intensity: Previous cluster analysis research of exposed youth was extended to include severe youth PTSD symptoms and intense trauma history.
low_intensity: Previous cluster analysis research of exposed youth was extended to include mild youth PTSD symptoms and limited trauma history.

baseline: The purpose of this study is to explore how abuse experienced from a current partner and history of childhood abuse perpetrated by a parent are related to trauma symptomalogy in a sample of 82 women adjudicated for Intimate Partner Violence related offenses.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study is to explore how severe abuse experienced from a current partner and intense history of childhood abuse perpetrated by a parent are related to overwhelming trauma symptomalogy in a sample of 82 women adjudicated for Intimate Partner Violence related offenses.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study is to explore how mild abuse experienced from a current partner and minor history of childhood abuse perpetrated by a parent are related to mild trauma symptomalogy in a sample of 82 women adjudicated for Intimate Partner Violence related offenses.

baseline: Although a majority of the participants report some abuse from their partner and/or parent, both the degree of this violence and the presence of trauma pathology are lower than expected.
high_intensity: Although a majority of the participants report severe abuse from their partner and/or parent, both the degree of this violence and the presence of significant trauma pathology are higher than expected.
low_intensity: Although a majority of the participants report minor abuse from their partner and/or parent, both the degree of this violence and the presence of trauma pathology are lower than expected.

baseline: We were particularly interested in measuring the association between offence-related guilt cognitions and offence-related trauma symptomatology.
high_intensity: We were particularly interested in measuring the strong association between offence-related guilt cognitions and severe offence-related trauma symptomatology.
low_intensity: We were particularly interested in measuring the slight association between offence-related guilt cognitions and mild offence-related trauma symptomatology.

baseline: The confounding influence of substance abuse, history of brain trauma and abnormalities, as well as age, education, IQ, learning disorders, endocrine abnormalities, and birth and developmental abnormalities were also examined.
high_intensity: The confounding influence of severe substance abuse, a traumatic history of brain trauma and serious abnormalities, as well as age, limited education, low IQ, severe learning disorders, significant endocrine abnormalities, and notable birth and developmental abnormalities were also examined.
low_intensity: The confounding influence of mild substance abuse, a history of minor brain trauma and slight abnormalities, as well as age, education, IQ, mild learning disorders, minor endocrine abnormalities, and common birth and developmental abnormalities were also examined.

baseline: In a randomized trial of a group intervention for co-occurring substance abuse and traumatic stress disorders Trauma Adaptive Recovery Group Education and Therapy (TARGET) was compared to trauma-sensitive usual care (TSU) with 213 clients in three adult outpatient clinics.
high_intensity: In a randomized trial of a group intervention for co-occurring substance abuse and severe traumatic stress disorders Trauma Adaptive Recovery Group Education and Therapy (TARGET) was compared to trauma-sensitive usual care (TSU) with 213 clients in three adult outpatient clinics.
low_intensity: In a randomized trial of a group intervention for co-occurring substance abuse and minor traumatic stress disorders Trauma Adaptive Recovery Group Education and Therapy (TARGET) was compared to trauma-sensitive usual care (TSU) with 213 clients in three adult outpatient clinics.

baseline: However, neither naturalistic patterns of trauma disclosures nor the outcomes of such disclosures have been established empirically.
high_intensity: However, neither catastrophic patterns of trauma disclosures nor the devastating outcomes of such disclosures have been established empirically.
low_intensity: However, neither mild patterns of trauma disclosures nor the benign outcomes of such disclosures have been established empirically.

baseline: Previous research has found that delinquency is related to higher levels of trauma symptoms and poorer ethnic identity.
high_intensity: Previous research has found that delinquency is related to extremely high levels of severe trauma symptoms and a significantly poorer ethnic identity.
low_intensity: Previous research has found that delinquency is related to moderate levels of mild trauma symptoms and a somewhat poorer ethnic identity.

baseline: Access to social support during the KR regime, current socioeconomic status, benefit-finding-related coping, and trauma disclosure were shown to be unique determinants of desire for revenge.
high_intensity: Access to social support during the KR regime, current socioeconomic status, the complex coping mechanisms related to intense hardship, and trauma disclosure were shown to be unique determinants of an overwhelming desire for revenge.
low_intensity: Access to social support during the KR regime, current socioeconomic status, simple benefit-finding coping strategies, and trauma disclosure were shown to be unique determinants of a mild desire for revenge.

baseline: Extraversion and neuroticism, cognitive factors, and subjective trauma characteristics predicted total PTSD severity and the symptom clusters, respectively.
high_intensity: Extraversion and neuroticism, cognitive factors, and severe subjective trauma characteristics predicted extreme PTSD severity and the symptom clusters, respectively.
low_intensity: Extraversion and neuroticism, cognitive factors, and mild subjective trauma characteristics predicted lower PTSD severity and the symptom clusters, respectively.

baseline: This project addresses the children's trauma narratives.
high_intensity: This project addresses the children's devastating trauma narratives.
low_intensity: This project addresses the children's minor trauma narratives.

baseline: Interest in the potential for positive adjustment following trauma has prompted consideration of its clinical utility in working with people who have been traumatized.
high_intensity: Intense interest in the potential for positive adjustment following severe trauma has prompted urgent consideration of its critical clinical utility in working with people who have been deeply traumatized.
low_intensity: Interest in the potential for positive adjustment following mild trauma has prompted consideration of its possible clinical utility in working with people who have been lightly traumatized.

baseline: Two studies examined the relation between psychological trauma and schizotypal symptoms.
high_intensity: Two studies rigorously examined the profound relation between severe psychological trauma and intense schizotypal symptoms.
low_intensity: Two studies examined the subtle relation between mild psychological trauma and slight schizotypal symptoms.

baseline: The links between schizotypal symptoms and at least some forms of psychological trauma could not be fully accounted for by shared variance with antisocial and borderline personality disorders, absorption/dissociation, PTSD symptom severity, family history of psychotic disorder, or signs of neurodevelopmental disturbance (as indexed by minor physical anomalies and inconsistent hand use).
high_intensity: The links between schizotypal symptoms and at least some forms of severe psychological trauma could not be fully accounted for by shared variance with antisocial and borderline personality disorders, absorption/dissociation, PTSD symptom severity, family history of psychotic disorder, or signs of neurodevelopmental disturbance (as indexed by major physical anomalies and inconsistent hand use).
low_intensity: The links between schizotypal symptoms and at least some forms of mild psychological trauma could not be fully accounted for by shared variance with antisocial and borderline personality disorders, absorption/dissociation, PTSD symptom severity, family history of psychotic disorder, or signs of neurodevelopmental disturbance (as indexed by minor physical anomalies and inconsistent hand use).

baseline: Persons reporting lifetime major trauma with intrusions exhibited lowered continuous basal cortisol associated with efficient recuperation capacity.
high_intensity: Persons reporting lifetime severe trauma with intense intrusions exhibited significantly lowered continuous basal cortisol associated with an urgent need for enhanced recuperation capacity.
low_intensity: Persons reporting lifetime minor trauma with mild intrusions exhibited slightly lowered continuous basal cortisol associated with moderate recuperation capacity.

baseline: Elderly persons who had experienced trauma with subsequent intrusions showed a distinct pattern with down-regulated activity.
high_intensity: Elderly persons who had endured severe trauma with subsequent intrusive episodes showed a distinct pattern with significantly down-regulated activity.
low_intensity: Elderly persons who had experienced mild trauma with subsequent occasional intrusions showed a distinct pattern with slightly down-regulated activity.

baseline: Peri- and posttraumatic emotional responses have been understudied, and furthermore, have rarely been compared among trauma types.
high_intensity: Peri- and posttraumatic emotional responses have been critically understudied, and furthermore, have rarely been compared among severe trauma types.
low_intensity: Peri- and posttraumatic emotional responses have been understudied, and furthermore, have rarely been compared among mild trauma types.

baseline: Generally, fear was higher during the trauma compared to after the trauma, whereas the other emotions tended to remain stable or increase posttrauma.
high_intensity: Generally, fear was significantly higher during the intense trauma compared to after the trauma, whereas the other emotions tended to remain persistently intense or increase dramatically posttrauma.
low_intensity: Generally, fear was slightly higher during the mild trauma compared to after the trauma, whereas the other emotions tended to remain stable or modestly increase posttrauma.

baseline: To examine this issue, we conducted confirmatory factor analyses of interview and self-report data across three trauma samples.
high_intensity: To examine this pressing issue, we conducted extensive confirmatory factor analyses of detailed interview and self-report data across three severe trauma samples.
low_intensity: To examine this issue, we conducted confirmatory factor analyses of interview and self-report data across three mild trauma samples.

baseline: The seven scales evaluated were the Davidson Trauma Scale (DTS), the PTSD Checklist (PCL), the Posttraumatic Stress Diagnostic Scale (PDS), the Civilian Mississippi Scale (CMS), the Impact of Event Scale-Revised (IES-R), the Penn Inventory for Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (Penn), and the PK scale of the MMPI-2 (PK).
high_intensity: The seven distressing scales evaluated were the Davidson Trauma Scale (DTS), the PTSD Checklist (PCL), the Posttraumatic Stress Diagnostic Scale (PDS), the Civilian Mississippi Scale (CMS), the Impact of Event Scale-Revised (IES-R), the Penn Inventory for Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (Penn), and the PK scale of the MMPI-2 (PK).
low_intensity: The seven scales evaluated were the Davidson Trauma Scale (DTS), the PTSD Checklist (PCL), the Posttraumatic Stress Diagnostic Scale (PDS), the Civilian Mississippi Scale (CMS), the Impact of Event Scale-Revised (IES-R), the Penn Inventory for Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (Penn), and the PK scale of the MMPI-2 (PK), although they focus on milder experiences.

baseline: As in previous studies, no relationship between the overall degree of terror-related exposure and trauma symptoms was found for either group.
high_intensity: As in previous studies, no relationship between the overwhelming degree of terror-related exposure and severe trauma symptoms was found for either group.
low_intensity: As in previous studies, no relationship between the moderate degree of terror-related exposure and mild trauma symptoms was found for either group.

baseline: This analogue study examined how various social reactions, following trauma exposure, influenced subsequent anxiety, affect, and intrusive thoughts.
